programme.title: Wild Australia
programme.desc: Australia is one of the largest and most extreme wildernesses on earth. Here, the indigenous Aborigines have survived by observing and learning from nature.

programme.title: Wild Australia
programme.desc: Australia is one of the largest and most extreme wildernesses on earth. Here, the indigenous Aborigines have survived by observing and learning from nature.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: An undercover investigation leads the team to a shocking discovery: eight dogs tied to metal chains as well as dog-fighting paraphernalia, illegal drugs and a gun.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: A shocking case of animal cruelty arrives at the Pennsylvania SPCA: a Labrador named Clyde has been attacked by another dog and left without veterinary care.

programme.title: Alaska: Surviving the Last Frontier
programme.desc: Four groups of ordinary people are dropped into the remote wilderness of Alaska by bush pilot and survival expert Paul Claus. As each group struggles to find their new home in the wild they must overcome bears, glaciers and their fears.

programme.title: Pandamonium
programme.desc: The pandas in the Wolong Panda Reserve in China have been followed by camera teams for a year. Thanks to the pioneering research performed at the reserve, 16 cubs have been born.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: The homestead of musician Lou and partner Stacey is threatened by water erosion and at serious risk from a torrential rainstorm. The Raneys come to the rescue.

programme.title: Dogs: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Discover how dogs have evolved from wild predators to friendly pets. Plus, a look at parts of the world where dogs are spoiled as much as children.

programme.title: Dogs: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Journey around the world and discover how dogs became one of the most valued animals on the planet. From wild predators to friendly pets- this is the story of mans best friend.

programme.title: Dogs: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Journey around the world and discover how dogs became one of the most valued animals on the planet. From wild predators to friendly pets- this is the story of mans best friend.

programme.title: Dogs: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Journey around the world and discover how dogs became one of the most valued animals on the planet. From wild predators to friendly pets- this is the story of mans best friend.

programme.title: Dogs: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Follow stray pups in Thailand through the first weeks of their dangerous lives. And in Kathmandu, dogs are worshipped and dressed with garlands for the Tihar festival.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr. Jeff treats a skittish Savannah cat with an unusual condition. And, the team races to save a stray dog as it runs toward the freeway.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: The team cares for abandoned kittens. Plus, Dr. Jeff gives hope to a concerned owner when their beloved dog is diagnosed with cancer and a rescue tiger finds love.

programme.title: Gamechangers: Inventing The World
programme.desc: Two technology entrepreneurs harness the power of solar energy to solve two different problems: water contamination in Ghana and jungle preservation in South America.

programme.title: Gamechangers: Inventing The World
programme.desc: Two pioneers in electric power both aim to develop technologies that reduce carbon emissions - both using electric motors and batteries in aviation and speedboats.

programme.title: Saba And The Rhinos Secret
programme.desc: Adventurous wildlife expert Saba Douglas-Hamilton goes on an extraordinary journey to reveal the true personality and secret life of the rhino.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: With thousands of animals in need, and vet care unaffordable to most, Dr Jeff heads to Mexico to run a mobile clinic and help as many people and pets as they can.

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: Puma is peeing on its owners clothes and attacking his dog Daisy, so Jackson comes in to help him and his pregnant wife get their life back; snowshoe cat Riley has a deadly immunodeficiency disease and is vicious toward its owners other cat Mia.

programme.title: Jeremy Wades Dark Waters
programme.desc: The Lake Garda Monster has been described as a huge, humped bear -- half snake, half dinosaur. Jeremy travels to northern Italy to investigate, and discovers that these picturesque waters could be hiding several enormous beasts.

programme.title: Jeremy Wades Dark Waters
programme.desc: Jeremy Wade travels to Alaska to investigate the disappearance of the king salmon. His search will take him through grizzly bear territory, remote native communities and the Pacific Ocean as he follows a trail of evidence.

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: How does a squirrel take on a dangerous rattle snake? What makes eagles eyes so powerful? Plus, why is the planet overrun with bugs? Experts answer these questions!

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: Do parrots really know what theyre talking about? How do electric eels not electrocute themselves? Plus, why are pandas black and white?

programme.title: Wild Mexico
programme.desc: Mexico. It is an ancient, majestic land, full of diversity and mystery. It is home to a vast wilderness of oceans, deserts, jungle, and unique creatures that are found nowhere else on earth.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: An x-ray provides some surprising and crucial evidence in an investigation into a case of three starving dogs. Investigator AJ Meadows confronts the owner with the truth about what her animals had been eating.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Investigators help an 80-strong police team raid a cock-fighting ring, before rescuing three puppies whose tails have been docked.

programme.title: In Search Of Monsters
programme.desc: Experts explore a new theory surrounding Scotlands Loch Ness Monster. The creature may not only be real, but possibly more dangerous than ever imagined.

programme.title: Adrift: 47 Days with Sharks
programme.desc: A fatal plane crash left Louis Zamperini and Russell Phil Phillips stranded in the Pacific Ocean during the Second World War. Explore the extraordinary story of how the young Americans survived dehydration, famine and vicious sharks for 47 days.

programme.title: Wild Dubai
programme.desc: Behind modern Dubai lies a hidden treasure - an incredible wildlife that speaks of a timeless connection to the desert, the sea and the history and tradition of its people.

programme.title: Meet The Penguins
programme.desc: A large-scale leopard attack near Cape Town leaves thirty-three penguins dead. The sole survivor is picked up by rangers and rushed to Sanccob - but will he make it?

programme.title: Meet The Orangutans
programme.desc: Follow the lives of orphaned orangutan babies as they are brought to the worlds oldest orangutan sanctuary in Borneo. Toddlers are wheel-barrowed in for lessons in life.

programme.title: Sharkwrecked: Crash Landing
programme.desc: Paul de Gelder and James Glancy bail out of an aircraft at 3500-ft to experience what its like to crash land into some of the worlds most remote and shark-infested waters.

programme.title: Dogs: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Journey around the world and discover how dogs became one of the most valued animals on the planet. From wild predators to friendly pets- this is the story of mans best friend.

programme.title: Jeremy Wades Dark Waters
programme.desc: Fisherman and adventurer, Jeremy Wade, travels to western Australia to discover what is wiping out many of the fish in Australias Fitzroy River. What will he find?

programme.title: Jeremy Wades Dark Waters
programme.desc: Tales of monstrous pike have persisted in Europe for generations. Jeremy Wade is on a journey to catch this prehistoric monster, starting in the lakes of Ireland and leading to waters on the edge of the Arctic Circle in Sweden.

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: How does a squirrel take on a dangerous rattle snake? What makes eagles eyes so powerful? Plus, why is the planet overrun with bugs? Experts answer these questions!

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: Do parrots really know what theyre talking about? How do electric eels not electrocute themselves? Plus, why are pandas black and white?

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Freak weather hits Texas and the team fight to save eight horses swimming in a flooded pasture. The rescue is successful but a horse is left with potentially fatal wounds.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The investigators respond to a report of a dead puppy in a yard, but when they get there they find the animal is still alive and race to save it.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The entire team is called into action when four baby goats are rushed into the Houston SPCA shelter with life threatening injuries after being attacked by stray dogs.

programme.title: Jungle Shark
programme.desc: Dr. Craig OConnell and Andy Casagrande travel up the Serena River to try and find out why young bull sharks swim up the river, and how they avoid the crocodiles living there.

programme.title: Meet The Orangutans
programme.desc: Follow the lives of orphaned orangutan babies as they are brought to the worlds oldest orangutan sanctuary in Borneo. Toddlers are wheel-barrowed in for lessons in life.

programme.title: Meet The Orangutans
programme.desc: One orphan needs another, more experienced one to help them bed in. The babies are at high risk from parasites ingested from the ground.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr. Jeff helps 40 miniature Australian shepherds rescued from a puppy mill. And, vet technician Christine needs Dr. Jeffs help when her chihuahua struggles to walk.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr. Jeff helps a beloved German shepherd walk again. Meanwhile, Dr. Don has to act fast when a cat eats poison and a scared dog runs loose outside the clinic.

programme.title: Gamechangers: Inventing The World
programme.desc: Scientists around the world are working on projects dealing with space and space travel - extraterrestrial life, colonising Mars, the Big Bang and rocket development.

programme.title: Gamechangers: Inventing The World
programme.desc: Engineers are working on streamlining vehicles to improve fuel consumption and speed. Plus, a solar-powered car competes in an endurance race.

programme.title: Return To Shark Island
programme.desc: Shark scientist Dr. Craig OConnell, and Reunions CRA Shark Protection Program, investigates the ongoing shark crisis that is threatening this former island paradise.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff fights to save a bearded dragon which is having a seizure, and Dr Amy is put to the test when a routine cat neuter turns complicated.

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: Einsteins violent behavior toward fellow cat Izzy causes concern for the safety of his owners children; a couples sick cat pees all over the house and help is needed before their new baby arrives; extra footage and commentary is added.

programme.title: Jeremy Wades Dark Waters
programme.desc: A report of an underwater attack in Australia has caught Jeremy Wades attention. As his investigation unfolds, Jeremy is faced with the exciting possibility that a giant predator once thought extinct could be making a comeback.

programme.title: Jeremy Wades Dark Waters
programme.desc: Fisherman and adventurer, Jeremy Wade, is with a commercial fishing boat in Alaska, searching for giant halibut. Will they catch the sought-after 50-lb halibut?

programme.title: Life After: Chernobyl
programme.desc: The first scientists with unlimited access to the Chernobyl danger zone explore how the environment and wildlife are affected after 30 years in the most contaminated area on earth.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Wayde and Brett get patriotic when Olympic basketball star Paul George commissions two tanks next to his indoor pond - before his return from the Rio games.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Investigator Marisa McHugh and Field Ops Manager Stacie DaBolt rescue a dog whose limbs have been bound together before being left to die in a skip.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Investigator Marisa McHugh helps save the life of a puppy that was left for dead, before trying to hunt down the perpetrator.

programme.title: Alaska: Surviving the Last Frontier
programme.desc: Greg Pierson, who has never used a gun, sets out on a brutal mountain goat hunt whilst the other groups gather food before the winter.

programme.title: Animal ER
programme.desc: Theodore a four year old Maltese Terrier is brought into the vet hospital with a mystery illness, the vets struggle for a diagnosis as his condition gets worse.

programme.title: Wild Costa Rica
programme.desc: Explore the incredible creatures that inhabit Costa Rica, one of the most ecologically diverse places on earth. Meet the rare and secretive ocelot and puma, and much more.

programme.title: The Sharks Of Headstone Hell
programme.desc: Sharks gather at Norfolk Island, drawn by carcasses tossed into the sea.

programme.title: Adrift: 47 Days with Sharks
programme.desc: A fatal plane crash left Louis Zamperini and Russell Phil Phillips stranded in the Pacific Ocean during the Second World War. Explore the extraordinary story of how the young Americans survived dehydration, famine and vicious sharks for 47 days.

programme.title: Amba the Russian Tiger
programme.desc: Gordon Buchanan searches majestic Vladivostok for the Russian Tiger and meets the people who live with these elusive beasts.

programme.title: Jeremy Wades Dark Waters
programme.desc: Tasmania is home to species found nowhere else on earth, including a colossal freshwater beast capable of breaking a persons arm. Jeremy Wade ventures into the islands dense, eerie forests in search of this formidable creature.

programme.title: The Who - Live at Kilburn 1977
programme.desc: Capte avec des moyens exceptionnels (pellicule 35mm, six cameras, un enregistreur seize pistes), ce concert des Who est aussi lun des derniers de son exuberant batteur, Keith Moon. Une page epique de lhistoire du rock anglais.

programme.title: Gerhard Richter Painting
programme.desc: En 2009, Gerhard Richter ouvre son atelier à la realisatrice qui filme la naissance dune serie de toiles abstraites de grand format à dominantes jaune, rouge et bleue. Un temoignage sur le travail eminemment physique fourni par cet artiste contemporain parmi les plus cotes.

programme.title: Kix ! 400 coups à Budapest
programme.desc: Suivi pendant une decennie, le jeune Sanyi pousse comme une herbe folle dans les rues de la capitale magyare. En creux, le portrait d’un quart-monde loin de la Hongrie idealisee par Viktor Orban.

programme.title: Le dessous des cartes
programme.desc: Le Soudan est plonge depuis plus de deux ans dans une guerre meurtrière trop souvent oubliee, declenchee par la rivalite entre deux generaux, Al-Burhan et Hemetti. Après des decennies de dictature et une scission douloureuse avec le Soudan du Sud, le pays connaît une nouvelle tragedie, marquee par des exactions contre les civils et un deplacement massif de populations.

programme.title: Delacroix, un air de liberte
programme.desc: En 1830, Eugène Delacroix livre sa vision de la revolution de Juillet, à laquelle il a assiste, dans "La Liberte guidant le peuple". Suivant les etapes de sa restauration au Louvre, le realisateur Martin Fraudreau plonge dans cette page dhistoire et retrace le destin d’une toile devenue icône universelle.

programme.title: Kandinsky : voir la musique, reinventer la peinture
programme.desc: Comment la musique a profondement inspire et infuse l’oeuvre de Vassily Kandinsky (1866-1944), pionnier de l’abstraction. Une exploration sensible de l’univers du peintre avant-gardiste, considere comme l’un des artistes phares du XXe siècle.

programme.title: 360° Reportage
programme.desc: Soucieux de voir se perpetuer les traditions de l’Église orthodoxe georgienne et de faire vivre le patrimoine culturel de son pays, frère Iakobi s’emploie à preserver la lignee des bergers du Caucase, une race de chiens originaire de la region.

programme.title: 360° Reportage
programme.desc: Pendant des siècles, les bergers albanais ont parcouru les Balkans avec leurs troupeaux, en quete d’herbe fraîche et d’eau pour leurs chèvres et moutons. Mais la dictature communiste a mis un terme à cette tradition. Après la chute du regime, les bergers ont essaye d’initier leurs enfants à la vie pastorale, mais ceux-ci ont quitte les campagnes pour aller etudier en ville. Quel avenir pour les bergers des Balkans ?

programme.title: GEO Reportage
programme.desc: En Haute-Corse, depuis plus de 6000 ans, la "Castagniccia" recouvre des collines à perte de vue. Aujourdhui, dans les villages presque deserts, quelques irreductibles tentent de rendre aux châtaigniers leur valeur dantan.

programme.title: Invitation au voyage
programme.desc: À la decouverte du Danemark à travers trois reportages : le festin de Karen Blixen, les peintres de Skagen et le parc d’attractions de Bakken.

programme.title: Cuisines des terroirs
programme.desc: Dans les montagnes du sud de l’Albanie, Dhurata et son mari Sofo ont change de vie : avec 320 chèvres, vaches et volailles, un cheval, un mulet et un grand potager, la famille produit desormais presque tout ce dont elle a besoin. Dhurata confectionne elle-meme chaque pot de "turshis" – des legumes marines dans la saumure, l’huile ou le vinaigre pour assurer leur conservation.

programme.title: LAfrique vue du ciel
programme.desc: Des immenses etendues naturelles sauvages aux megalopoles, une decouverte spectaculaire du continent africain depuis le ciel.

programme.title: Mondes sauvages
programme.desc: Dans les forets, les champs ou en peripherie des villes, la cohabitation avec le sanglier sest fortement degradee en raison de sa surpopulation. L’ecologue et geographe Raphaël Mathevet cherche à comprendre les tensions generees par l’animal et à elaborer des strategies pour restaurer cette cohabitation autrefois harmonieuse.

programme.title: Les maîtres des abeilles
programme.desc: Au coeur de la foret de Mukogodo vit le peuple yaaku. Assimiles à partir des annees 1930 par les guerriers maasai, les Yaaku, qui ne sont plus que 5 000 au Kenya, ont garde une particularite : ils continuent à partager leur quotidien avec les abeilles, craintes par les Maasai pourtant amateurs de miel.

programme.title: Witness
programme.desc: À la mort de son mari, Rachel et son fils Samuel, membres de la communaute amish, decident de prendre quelques jours de repos à Baltimore. À la gare de Philadelphie, le petit Samuel est le seul temoin du meurtre dun agent secret de la division des narcotiques. John Book Book, linspecteur en charge de lenquete, va rapidement decouvrir que ses superieurs sont impliques.

programme.title: Les maîtres des abeilles
programme.desc: L’abeille carniolienne est originaire de Slovenie. Les habitants de ce petit pays des Balkans nourrissent un profond respect pour cette espèce autochtone. Brane Kozinc, issu d’une longue lignee d’apiculteurs, est l’un des quinze eleveurs officiels du pays. Il a installe ses ruches sur les pentes du Triglav, le plus haut sommet slovène, situe dans les Alpes juliennes.

programme.title: Mondes sauvages
programme.desc: Le biologiste Laurent Tillon, de l’Office national des forets, nourrit une passion pour les chauves-souris. Pour lui, ces petits mammifères nocturnes sont mal perçus alors que leur place en haut de la chaîne alimentaire en fait de precieuses sentinelles de l’etat des forets. Les etudier en vue de les proteger apparaît donc essentiel pour la preservation de l’environnement.

programme.title: Invitation au voyage
programme.desc: Trois reportages pour decouvrir la ville de Recife, au Bresil : la revelation de Jean-Christophe Rufin, le frevo fait danser le nord-est du pays, l’epopee des “baleines volantes”.

programme.title: 360° Reportage
programme.desc: Selim Hutoglu et sa famille vivent en Turquie dans la province de Rize, au pied des monts Kaçkar. Chaque annee, au debut de l’ete, ils partent avec leurs vaches pour trois mois dans la montagne, à 3100 mètres d’altitude. Là-haut, les betes paissent, la famille fait du fromage et profite du grand air. Mais chaque annee, l’ascension pour rejoindre le plateau est perilleuse.

programme.title: Inde, la fete des couleurs
programme.desc: En Inde, les veuves sont rejetees, stigmatisees et doivent porter le blanc, couleur de la mort. À Vrindavan cependant, elles trouvent refuge dans des foyers qui leur sont reserves et peuvent ainsi pour la première fois celebrer Holi, la fete des couleurs.

programme.title: ARTE Reportage
programme.desc: Au Chili, l’eau se rarefie, accaparee par l’intelligence artificielle et ses data centers energivores / Quinze ans après la catastrophe de Fukushima, le Japon relance le nucleaire, alors que les anciens dechets restent radioactifs.

programme.title: ARTE Journal
programme.desc: Chaque jour à 19h45, la redaction franco-allemande dARTE Journal propose une approche europeenne et culturelle de lactualite. Un regard original sur le monde.

programme.title: 28 minutes samedi
programme.desc: Retour sur lactualite internationale : lelection de Zohran Mamdani à la mairie de New York ; l’ultra fast-fashion, un desastre ecologique et social qui cartonne ; la levee de fonds reussie des employes de Duralex ; linauguration du Grand Musee du Caire.

programme.title: Émigres europeens, des recits oublies
programme.desc: De 1618 à 1933, les persecutions religieuses, les guerres ou la misère ont pousse des millions dhabitants des regions rhenanes et germanophones à sexiler à travers le monde. À l’aune de temoignages mis au jour par les historiens, cette fresque documentaire passionnante raconte leurs parcours et retrace, sur trois siècles, ces grandes vagues migratoires parties dEurope.

programme.title: Émigres europeens, des recits oublies
programme.desc: De 1618 à 1933, les persecutions religieuses, les guerres ou la misère ont pousse des millions dhabitants des regions rhenanes et germanophones à sexiler à travers le monde. Deuxième volet : en 1750, le Nouveau Monde attire de plus en plus de colons europeens...

programme.title: Émigres europeens, des recits oublies
programme.desc: De 1618 à 1933, les persecutions religieuses, les guerres ou la misère ont pousse des millions dhabitants des regions rhenanes et germanophones à sexiler à travers le monde. Dernier volet : dès la moitie du XIXe siècle, les migrations de germanophones deviennent massives et participent à la conquete de l’Ouest americain.

programme.title: Internet, un geant très vulnerable
programme.desc: Alors qu’Internet fonctionne grâce à un vaste reseau de câbles sous-marins fortement expose aux risques d’accident et de sabotage, comment repondre aux defis strategiques mais aussi ecologiques de la toile planetaire ? Et que se passerait-il en cas de panne mondiale ?

programme.title: Court-circuit
programme.desc: Trois perles du cinema danimation : "Mother’s Child" de Naomi Noir, "House of Existence" de Joung Yumi et "The Garden of Alalá" de Sophie Biesenbach-Jansen et David Jansen.

programme.title: 42 - La reponse à presque tout
programme.desc: Faire la fete, se desinhiber, noyer son chagrin... Toutes les occasions sont bonnes pour consommer de l’alcool. Mais la limite entre plaisir et dependance est tenue. Cet episode se penche sur le rôle socioculturel de la boisson, et sur son impact sanitaire. Pourquoi buvons-nous alors que nous en connaissons les risques ?

programme.title: Mondes sauvages
programme.desc: Les icebergs, blocs immenses qui se detachent de la calotte glacière, nous rappellent la fragilite de notre monde. Partant de l’hypothèse que ces colosses ephemères sont des etres vivants comme les autres, le philosophe Olivier Remaud va les observer au Groenland.

programme.title: Naked
programme.desc: Fille ou garçon ? À la naissance, la question paraît simple et tranchee. Dans la realite pourtant, certaines personnes ne s’epanouissent pas dans le genre qui leur a ete attribue. Les scientifiques etudient le rôle que nos societes empreintes de binarite assignent, elles aussi, à notre cerveau.

programme.title: Le clavecin selon Jean Rondeau
programme.desc: Rencontre avec l’enfant terrible du clavecin qui a contribue à sa renaissance par la modernite de son approche.

programme.title: Les maîtres des abeilles
programme.desc: Niche à l’extremite de la peninsule du Yucatán, l’État de Campeche abrite de vastes etendues de jungle et des sites archeologiques mayas. Mais il recèle un autre secret millenaire. C’est ici que des apiculteurs mayas ont decide il y a vingt ans de sauver de la disparition l’abeille melipone, une abeille autochtone sans dard menacee par sa cousine venue du continent europeen, l’"Apis mellifera".

programme.title: 42 - La reponse à presque tout
programme.desc: L’hibernation humaine : un fantasme aussi vieux que la science-fiction. Certains scientifiques pensent pourtant que nous sommes dotes de dispositions genetiques nous permettant d’hiberner. Un repos artificiel qui ferait economiser enormement de ressources et ouvrirait de nouvelles perspectives d’exploration spatiale. D’ailleurs, des chercheurs etudient dejà la faisabilite de ces technologies.

programme.title: L’IA va-t-elle tuer Internet ?
programme.desc: Envahi par un flot de bots, dimages et de videos generes par lintelligence artificielle, Internet croule aujourdhui sous les contenus synthetiques sans interet. Quel avenir attend le Web à lère de lIA ?

programme.title: Internet, un geant très vulnerable
programme.desc: Alors qu’Internet fonctionne grâce à un vaste reseau de câbles sous-marins fortement expose aux risques d’accident et de sabotage, comment repondre aux defis strategiques mais aussi ecologiques de la toile planetaire ? Et que se passerait-il en cas de panne mondiale ?

programme.title: ARTE Junior, le mag
programme.desc: Pourquoi le chocolat nous rend-il heureux ? Et depuis quand en mange-t-on ? La reponse dans notre emission.

programme.title: 42 - La reponse à presque tout
programme.desc: Dans une societe democratique, les decisions sont reputees relever du libre arbitre. Mais est-ce toujours le cas ? Sachant que le cerveau se met parfois en mode "pilote automatique", la liberte de choix n’est peut-etre qu’une illusion. Et si nos choix etaient davantage dictes par des facteurs physiques ou neurologiques ?

programme.title: 100 ans d’evolution de l’habitat
programme.desc: Il y a cent ans naissait l’architecture moderne, un nouveau modèle centre sur la lutte contre l’insalubrite et l’exiguïte de l’habitat. Cet episode sinteresse à la "cuisine de Francfort", une installation où tout est à portee de main, developpee en 1926 par l’architecte autrichienne Margarete Schutte-Lihotzky pour des logements sociaux.

programme.title: Twist
programme.desc: Adorables bebes, chats ou chiots : les contenus mignons envahissent les reseaux sociaux. Cette esthetique du "cute" n’est pourtant pas nouvelle. On la retrouve partout, dans l’art, le design et la mode, comme en temoignent les "Labubus", ces peluches porte-cles venues de Chine. Cette tendance trouve ses origines dans la culture "kawaii", un mot japonais signifiant mignon.

programme.title: Umoja, le village sans hommes
programme.desc: Dans un petit village du nord du Kenya, une communaute de femmes rescapees de violences, apprennent à se reconstruire et vivre en autonomie.

programme.title: Cuisines des terroirs
programme.desc: Comme de nombreux Ouzbeks, Bahriddin Yunusov cultive des fruits et legumes à côte de sa maison. En automne, les coings sont mûrs et Bahriddin les recolte avant les premières gelees. Il s’agit d’une variete particulièrement sucree que l’on peut manger fraichement cueillie et avec la peau.

programme.title: Les maîtres des abeilles
programme.desc: Dans son centre apicole de Rosenfeld, dans le Bade-Wurtemberg, Norbert Poeplau a mis au point une ruche revolutionnaire dans laquelle l’habitat des ouvrières et l’espace de production du miel sont places sur le meme plan, à l’horizontale, pour laisser aux abeilles la liberte de construire leur colonie comme elles l’entendent.

programme.title: Au fil des Andes
programme.desc: Avec ses 7 500 kilomètres, la cordillère des Andes, la plus longue chaîne de montagnes continentale au monde, traverse l’Amerique du Sud. En Colombie, aux portes de Bogotá, les sommets du parc national naturel de Chingaza atteignent 4 000 mètres d’altitude, offrant un premier aperçu de la splendeur des Andes.

programme.title: Au fil des Andes
programme.desc: Certains Peruviens considèrent encore les Andes et leurs majestueux volcans comme des divinites, et leur offrent des sacrifices avant chaque ascension. Si les seize volcans actifs qui s’y reveillent episodiquement empechent les habitants de vivre en toute quietude, le feerique lac Titicaca, berceau de la civilisation inca, constitue un refuge apaisant pour les populations qui y sont installees.

programme.title: Quand lhistoire fait dates
programme.desc: Mystique et beguine, Marguerite Porete est condamnee et executee par le feu à Paris en 1310 pour avoir ecrit un livre juge heretique par lÉglise. Dans le contexte des grands procès politiques de Philippe le Bel, l’execution de Marguerite Porete est-il le prelude à la chasse aux sorcières ?

programme.title: Le crime etait presque parfait
programme.desc: Un joueur de tennis desargente, redoutant que son epouse fortunee ne le quitte au profit dun romancier americain, met au point un complot afin de la supprimer tout en gardant les apparences de son côte.

programme.title: Les beautes de la cordillère des Andes
programme.desc: Dans la cordillère des Andes, un geologue passionne etudie comment les mouvements des plaques tectoniques, les volcans, les glaciers, le vent, leau et le soleil sculptent les paysages de ces montagnes grandioses.

programme.title: Au fil des Andes
programme.desc: Les paysages de Bolivie fascinent, mais la nature peut aussi y etre profondement inhospitalière...

programme.title: Felix Vallotton, les couleurs du desir
programme.desc: Un siècle après sa disparition, lart de Felix Vallotton, peintre, graveur, dessinateur et ecrivain d’origine suisse, n’a rien perdu de sa puissance ambiguë. À travers la figure feminine, qui hante son oeuvre, ce documentaire tente de percer le mystère d’un artiste insaisissable.

programme.title: Les grands moments de la musique - Le documentaire - Le New York Philharmonic à Pyongyang
programme.desc: Le concert le plus insolite de son histoire ? Retour sur la prestation de lOrchestre philharmonique de New York, dirige par Lorin Maazel, en... Coree du Nord, en 2008.

programme.title: Karambolage
programme.desc: Le mur de Berlin est tombe le 9 novembre 1989. Qu’en reste-t-il aujourd’hui ? - Ce qui me manque : lassiette à escargots - Gros plan sur ces soldats victimes de la Première Guerre mondiale à qui on a donne un nom en France, mais pas en Allemagne : les gueules cassees.

programme.title: ARTE Journal
programme.desc: Chaque jour à 19h45, la redaction franco-allemande dARTE Journal propose une approche europeenne et culturelle de lactualite. Un regard original sur le monde.

programme.title: Bruce Springsteen, le chanteur qui murmurait à loreille de lAmerique
programme.desc: Retour sur la carrière du "Boss", icône sensible et revoltee dont la guitare a accompagne les combats brûlants de son siècle – et qui a presente au monde le meilleur visage de lAmerique.

programme.title: Sully
programme.desc: Ce 15 janvier 2009, lorsque le commandant Sullenberger, dit "Sully", decolle de laeroport LaGuardia de New York, avec son copilote Jeff Skiles, rien ne presage ce qui va se passer à bord du vol US Airways 1549, à destination de Charlotte, en Caroline du Nord… Deux minutes après le decollage, alors que lAirbus A320 survole le Bronx à plus de 850 mètres daltitude, des oiseaux heurtent les deux reacteurs. Limpact est aussi soudain que devastateur.

programme.title: Tombstone
programme.desc: Ancien sherif de Dodge City, Wyatt Earp sinstalle à Tombstone avec sa femme et ses deux frères. Il retrouve son vieil ami Doc Holliday, joueur invetere et alcoolique. Mais très vite il se heurte au dangereux gangster Curly Bill, aux frères Clanton et au tueur sadique Johnny Ringo...

programme.title: Gaetano Donizetti : Maria Stuarda - Teatro Real, Madrid
programme.desc: Dans la seconde moitie du XVIe siècle, Élisabeth Ire d’Angleterre et sa cousine ecossaise Marie Stuart s’affrontent... À Madrid, le chef d’orchestre Jose Miguel Perez-Sierra et le metteur en scène David McVicar s’emparent du drame lyrique de Donizetti, avec Lisette Oropesa et Aigul Akhmetshina dans le rôle des reines rivales.

Lamput gets misunderstood as the Chosen One according to the tribe’s prophecy. The tribe hails Lamput as the prophet and this proves to be a huge challenge for the Docs to catch Lamput, now that Lamput is surrounded by worshippers and guards at all times!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy wants to watch TV in peace. The Lemmings have other plans: they want to have fun playing music with homemade instruments. Exasperated by the racket theyre making in the garage, Grizzy destroys the instruments and sends the Lemmings flying. The Lemmings discover a magic ukulele that bewitches anyone who hears its music: the perfect tool to regain control of the cabin and get back to their concert.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy cant sleep because its too hot. He decides to confiscate the fans the Lemmings use to power their fake spaceship. Totally into their Space Opera game, the Lemmings try to repel the alien Grizzy with "laser" party favors and are propelled onto an "unknown planet": a volcano crater with a secret base where a rocket is ready to take off. The rocket carries the cabin into space. Its no longer a game: Grizzy and the Lemmings will have to face the dangers of outer space!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy uses insecticide and a fly swatter to get rid of vermin that are bothering him during his siesta. The Lemmings heal his last victim: a cute little insect they adopt as their house pet. Only problem, their starving mascot only eats wood! The cabin has lots of it, but when Grizzy realizes that an insect is eating his home from the inside, he takes drastic measures to eliminate it permanently.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy asks the Lemmings to play with a baby ostrich found outside in exchange for their ventilator.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy has played for too many hours on the console. His eyes are so fatigued he cannot stand a single ray of light. The Lemmings choose this very moment to throw a big birthday party with as many lights as possible! Grizzy goes to great lengths to settle the issue and decides to trip the power supply. The Lemmings discover a source of magical light deep in the savanna.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings decide to play hide-and-seek in the Savannah.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Ginger is in charge of taking care of her mothers bird, and Tom tries his hardest to keep from eating it.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Jerry pretends to be a vampire to scare Tom. As Tom balances trying to keep "vampire Jerry" at bay and helping the witches make a new potion, its up to Tom -- with the help of his friend Newt -- to defeat the vampire mouse!

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When Rick leaves Spike in charge of protecting the house against burglars, Spike steps up and trains Tom and Jerry to be his helpers. At first it seems like they are going to fumble their security jobs, but then a burglar proves to be no match for our destructive trio.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Dr Bigby creates a machine to turn back the hands of time for his beloved cat Wilson. Tom is trying to break into the lab to eat Jerry and Napoleon, and accidentally gets mistaken for a young Wilson and is taken home. Tom must convince Dr. Bigby hes got the wrong cat! Jerry and Napoleon are left with the real Wilson, who is a mean vicious cat.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean makes his own horror movie and ropes in Mrs Wicket as the star!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean has to look after Mrs Wicket’s goldfish but Scrapper the cat is keen to ‘help’.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: After (accidentally) rescuing a kitten from a tree Mr. Bean is set to have his picture in the newspaper!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: As Mr Bean settles down to watch his favourite TV programme he hears loud noises from next-door. He moves from house to garden but can’t escape the relentless cacophony of trumpets, electric drills, and screaming babies. Bean’s mind turns to thoughts of revenge….

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean wins two tickets for an exotic cruise and naturally he takes Teddy along for the trip of a lifetime. Once aboard the huge ocean liner Mr Bean soon settles into a life of luxury but while showing off to a new friend Bean becomes ‘man overboard’ and stranded on a dessert island. The hungrier he gets the wilder he becomes and desperate to find a way off the island.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean hopes to win some cash prizes at the funfair but it’s not as easy as it seems!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Beans electricity is cut off when Mrs Wicket sees her electricity bill, but he has a back-up idea - a wind turbine. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean attempts to retrieve his cash card and "accidently" ends up inside a bank vault.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean buys an expensive dress for Irma which he plans to return - so has to protect it from damage.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is furious with the untidy state of the streets and all the people who drop litter so he goes on a one-man mission to clean up the town. Armed with several bin bags Mr Bean collects all the rubbish and puts up his own ‘No Littering’ signs - which have absolutely no effect. When the police show no interest in his campaign Bean builds a homemade vacuuming contraption causing chaos and mayhem wherever he goes.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Lamput escapes the Lab and the unenviable task of orange-blob-retrieval falls to Specs and Skinny. The Boss equips them with increasingly expensive vehicles. The real issue might be staffing.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Docs’ latest invention generates identical versions of themselves and create a whole mob of ‘Duplicate’ Specs and Skinnies to catch Lamput! However, the device becomes faulty, and the Duplicates can’t be turned off. Now the Docs are stuck with annoying copies of themselves who are turning their lives upside down!

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: When Lamput disguises himself as a book and gets returned to the Library, the Docs have to be super quiet in their attempts to get him back. They finally manage to sneak past the Librarian, but all chaos erupts when they open a mysterious book in the restricted area. Lamput and the Docs have to team up to get the new ghostly resident back to where he belongs!

programme.title: Barneys World
programme.desc: Vivie is disappointed that the parks Splash Pad is closed. Barney creates a trip to the Castleverse, and Mel is confused when Vivie isnt having fun doing all the things Mel is doing. Mel realizes that its okay to have different interests.

programme.title: Barneys World
programme.desc: At lunch in the park, Mels friends are unwilling to try a taste of her kimchi. Barney whips up a beach day with Baby Bop, where she doesnt want to do anything new. The kids realize the value of trying new things to show others you care.

programme.title: Barneys World - Meet Barney
programme.desc: Baby Bop is playing a game of hide and seek behind the Barney Bench! With a little Barney magic, she shows off a couple of her dress-up costumes and skills, all while celebrating her fabulous self.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When all of the Batwheels (except for Bam) mysteriously disappear, Bam enlists the help of A.D.A.M, the original Batmobile, to help save his friends. Along the way, Bam comes to appreciate the old-school mobiles different crimefighting style as they team up to take on the Legion of Zoom.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Much to everyone’s surprise, Bam is secretly afraid of the dark. When Poison Ivy knocks out all the power in Gotham, Bam must conquer his fears to stop her.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Just like every year for Halloween Fred refuses to leave the house. He believes that no mysteries will be solved on that day and that nothing will go as planned.

programme.desc: Mr. Bean cannot, for the life of him, place the face of the uninvited fat bloke on his doorstep. An old school photograph and school cap just about jog his memory. programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy dreams that hes a valiant knight who has just delivered his beloved. programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Inspired by a magazine with a jewelry ad showing a man offering a diamond to a woman, Grizzy imagines himself offering the rangers engagement ring to his beloved she-bear. programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: When he accidentally sticks a computer microprocessor to his temple, Grizzy is transformed into an exceptionally intelligent being capable of predicting events to come.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Lamput

The Docs make the brave decision to see a therapist about these terrible dreams. programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: An escaped prisoner suffers hard labour under Mrs Wicket while Mr Bean puts his feet up in jail.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: When Grizzy and the Lemmings accidentally activate a magic disk representing the earth they are sent back in time to the prehistoric era.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy finds a bottle containing a love potion anyone who drinks it immediately falls in love with the first creature he sees.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings notice that Grizzy moves away from the jar of chocolate spread whenever he chases the fly buzzing around him. programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy discovers the ranger’s collection of bird calls by chance. With a simple blow of the whistle, he can attract a flock of partridges that are at his beck and call.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: While fighting over a jar of chocolate spread, Grizzy and the Lemmings set off a chain reaction which sends the jar flying into space, where it damages a space station.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Even for a giant seven foot bear, its not easy getting rid of pesky lemmings but its all fun seeing them constantly try to outsmart each other with cheeky plans.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy wants to try out the brand new packaging format of chocolate spread that he discovers in the rangers cupboard: a yummy-looking XXL jar. programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: After Kitty the Catmobile saves Bam when hes in a tight spot, Bam decides to take her on a ride along patrol in the hopes of recruiting her as a Batwheel - if he can convince her to stop playing long enough to focus on their mission!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Bibi wishes she could live a rule-free life like Jestah, so she decides to only focus on having fun instead. But when her actions put Batgirl in danger, Bibi must put the fun aside to stop Harley and save her hero.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: After he takes down Riddler with an impressive wheel slam move, the Batwheels give Buff the nickname "Tough Buff." But Buff abruptly bristles at the name, leading the Batwheels to realize that its not okay to call your friends nicknames that they dont like.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: After being zapped by Penguins Songinator ray, the Batwheels find themselves only able to communicate through song! Theyll need to learn to harmonize as a team to defeat the musical prankster.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Sam Sheepdog hires The Looney Builders to build him a salon. Sam offers his custom cut only to learn that different folks want different styles.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Pro snowboarder Pepper Polar Bear hires The Looney Builders to build a ski resort. Pepper soon learns that others have different skill levels.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Wile E. Coyote hires The Looney Builders to build him a house in the desert so he can be alone. The Road Runner tries to pay him a visit causing Wile E. to heighten his security measures.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders are hired by the town’s volunteer firefighters to build a fire truck. Duty calls and they build on the go as they make rescues throughout Looneyburg.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Madcap slapstick and mayhem as the celebrated cat and mouse plot against each other.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom is tricked into helping an evil magician capture all of the mice in the village but Jerry Van Mouseling foils the magicians plans.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Spike leaves Tom in charge of his boy Tyke only to discover upon his return that Tyke now behaves more like a cat than a dog.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom falls into a manhole and finds a magic cloak that turns him into King of the Catacombs.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom forced into driving a race car created by evil Dr. Otto terrorizes the village mice until Jerry Van Mouseling comes to their rescue.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella and Slippy are perfecting their triple corkscrews when Priya, Ella’s best friend from Earth, surprises her with a visit. Priya performs a perfect triple corkscrew to everyone’s amazement. Ella is frustrated that she still can’t seem to nail it.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: While playing ice hockey on Europa, an ice-covered moon of Jupiter, a stray puck hits Ella’s wrist and injures Maggie. Dad is sure he can fix her but will need palladium so he can fuse her fried circuits back together before she loses her memory.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Slippy wants to watch an eclipse so badly that he makes special safety goggles for himself and his friends. But Ella has a different plan. When she insists on going to watch a binary star supernova, Slippy opts out and heads off on his own.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella always looks forward to Momella Day. And this Momella day promises to be the most interstellar yet, because they are going to see a small but powerful Red Dwarf star!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Priya has arrived from Earth to complete a school project about Mars. Priya is unfamiliar with the planet and a bit nervous about its huge dust storms. Ella, Slippy and Madhu convince her she needs to visit Mars to get the best video for her project.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Its the Midsummer Festival, and everyone is contributing to it, with Badger as the master of ceremonies, the Jack of the Green. But when he finds himself trapped in his own home, how can the festival start?

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Everyone is too busy to play with Toad so he foolishly opens the lock gates in order to propel his new boat. But this creates a giant wave that demolishes the Otters’ holt downstream. Toad must now repair their home, finding help from an unexpected quarter.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Toad installs a new Mauss security system to protect Toad Hall from the weasels, but Toads arrogance and rudeness towards Mauss leaves Toad locked out of Toad Hall for good. Only a big, mouse-sized apology can put things right.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Toad shows off his new hammock but refuses to let anyone else have a nap in it. The weasels trap Toad in the hammock, leaving Toad Hall wide open for them. Can Toad’s friends use the hammock to regain Toad Hall?

This time he’s let in, but will Bean’s fake painted suit last long enough for him to get his free food?

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Specs and the jewel thief have a lot in common. They are both round and blue. Also they both like accelerating into blind corners. A full-speed collision results in an accidental identity mixup - suddenly the thief finds himself with a real job at the Lab, and poor old Specs is being used as bedding by a hulking prison inmate. When Lamput decides to open up a can of kick-butt, the thief starts to wonder if a life of crime might be safer after all. Specs has no doubt at all where hed prefer to be. Lamput unveils a surprising skill at the kung-fu nerve-pinch. Specs is busted out of the clink, and returns to the life he loves: sprinting alongside his best bud Skinny, constantly failing to catch ol Lamput.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Docs are in the mountains, doing mountainy things. They look through their binoculars and see Lamput in the distance, doing his own mountainy things. GET HIM! After a dramatic chase across the mountain range, Lamput escapes into a cave and the Docs pursue, but its no ordinary cave. Its the home of a very grumpy dragon who loves his beauty sleep! The Docs are captured and Lamput has to come to the rescue to save the day. Luckily for him, his new forest buddies and his specular musical skills might just help in coming up with a solution.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Docs chase Lamput to a haunted mansion populated by ghosts, monsters and all things spooky. Lamput makes quick friends with a ghost prince who happens to be the lord of the mansion, but the Docs run into much less friendlier characters while trying to catch Lamput.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings have organized a mega party at the cabin. This is obviously not to Grizzy’s liking and the bear throws them out. The Lemmings discover a cave where the party is even more fun, but their ruckus drives out the bats who seek refuge in the cabin. Terrified of them, Grizzy tries everything to get rid of them and understands that the most effective thing is the Lemmings’ ghetto blaster.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings activate the air conditioners AI, causing it to fall in love with the fridge

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy finds a white bear that fell out of a zoo’s refrigerated truck. After consulting the encyclopedia, he realizes that he and the bear are brothers of the same species! He decides to follow the encyclopedia’s instructions to the letter and take care of his brother during his hibernation. This runs counter to all of the Lemmings favorite activities. The Lemmings decide to create a false encyclopedia page which says that they too are bears. Grizzy is now obliged to treat them like brothers as well.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings’ hard rock concert is driving Grizzy mad. After kicking them out, Grizzy requisitions their ghetto blaster and listens to a relaxation cassette to calm down. The Lemmings discover an ancestral tree whose engraved strips of bark cast targeted maledictions. To recover their material, the Lemmings decide to drive Grizzy out by cursing him with the Ten Plaques of the Savanna.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Inspired by a magazine, Grizzy decides to redo the cabin’s interior design. To make sure everything is perfect, he ousts the Lemmings and their electric train. By chance, the Lemmings discover an underground futuristic premises in the middle of the savanna. From this secret place, they can see the entire savanna on a giant screen, down to the very inside of Grizzy’s cabin just like in a sandbox video game. By using the menus, they can have an impact on reality and thus... on Grizzy!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings find a magic stick that functions as a Yummy divining rod. Grizzy steals their stick and finds a Yummy deposit in the savanna. To take control over Grizzy’s discovery, the Lemmings set a trap to draw the bear far from the deposit and transform it into an industrial chocolate factory. Grizzy will want to recover his chocolate deposit.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Butch tricks Tom into switching places with him and sends Tom off to live the life of a street cat.Butch finds out that living Toms cushy life isnt what it seems when Jerry makes his life difficult and Gingers doting is humiliating. Tom finds that living off the street is tricky and difficult. They very quickly switch back to the way it was.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tuffy hires detectives Tom and Jerry to investigate the ghost hauntings in his house. At first Tom and Jerry think its just his imagination but discover that the house seems haunted. They find out its a rat who wanted to chase Tuffy out so he could live there with his family but is ok with sharing the home.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When it seems like Spike has developed an allergic reaction to Tom, Rick buys Ginger a hypoallergetic cat named Glory.At first it seems like shes too good to be true, but shes secretly making Spike, Tom and Jerry miserable. The three team up to get rid of Glory, but shes more cunning than she looks.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Dr. Bigby creates cookies that can give animals superpowers. Jerry and Napoleon sneak some cookies, and they have fun terrorizing Tom, an alley cat who has broken in to eat them. The tables are turned when Tom gets his hands on the cookies.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean has to deal with an unwanted house guest but the stubborn pest refuses to leave.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean tries to be romantic but his idea of romance is very different from his girlfriend’s.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean discovers being in hospital isnt always a bed of roses.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean has to replace his landlady’s cat after an unfortunate ‘accident’.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The animated antics of the hapless bumbler Mr Bean. Mr Bean enters a competition to win a trolley of free food!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean buys a new bookcase, but it is missing one vital element!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean decides to take Teddy on holiday to the seaside. But when he arrives at his hotel a spoilt little girl wants Teddy all for herself. And her protective dad only wants the best for his ‘princess’. An on-going tussle ensues between Mr Bean the little girl and her Dad resulting in a chase across the seaside town and onto the pier. No one comes between Mr Bean Teddy and their ‘relaxing’ holiday!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Beans newspaper keeps getting stolen. Who is the cunning culprit?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is trying to find a nice quiet place to read his book so he sets off for the Library. But instead of reading he becomes distracted by some funny online videos he sees on the Library’s computer. Before he knows it Mr Bean is recording his own video which is uploaded for everyone to see. Things start to go crazy when people check out his funny video and his popularity takes off. But does Mr Bean enjoy being in the public eye and how long will his celebrity last?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is obsessed with his favourite TV show Super Spy but takes his snooping a little too far.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Lamput has escaped yet again, and yet again, Specs and Skinny are in serious trouble with the Boss. He’s so fed up with their constant failure that he hires an out-of-towner: a super cool, hi-tech Doc who has all the moves and the attitude to match. The new guy’s hip to all of Lamput’s tricks, and before long, the shape shifting blob is safely back at the Lab. Specs and Skinny, robbed of their whole gig, end up on the streets, while Rival Doc gets all the glory. With glory comes blame, though, and when Lamput stages yet another signature crafty escape, the Boss turns all his fury on Rival Doc. Who hired this guy, anyway!? Lamput just wants things to be how they were. The orange blob helps the Docs get back their jobs at the Lab, Rival Doc is sent packing, and Lamput prepares yet another daring escape.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Lamput can’t stop reading and gets caught! Back at the lab, the story intrigues everyone who is brought on a captivating adventure – featuring Lamput, Specs and Skinny in the leading role of a classic folktale. Robinput and his mates fight evil dictatorship for the perfect bedtime story.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: There’s Football Fever as the Docs and Lamput go to watch the game! In the second half of the game, they end up on the pitch! Lamput causes havoc for the Docs as he disguises himself as flags, jerseys, whistles and even the football, but as they get closer to the 90th minute, they realise that it’s a team effort to win, and the game needs everyone to be on the same side.

programme.title: Barneys World
programme.desc: When Mel doesnt want to stop making a funny sound, Barney and the kids go on an adventure to the Pirate Desert Island to meet a clingy hermit crab named Hermie. Hermie helps Mel realize that theres a proper time and a place for certain behaviors.

programme.title: Barneys World
programme.desc: David wants to play video games all day, but Barney suggests a physical activity that gets all the kids involved; David then understands the importance of balancing these two types of entertainment.

programme.title: Barneys World - Meet Barney
programme.desc: Billy takes us on a tour all around the park while riding his scooter! Follow along as he shows off some of his coolest moves.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When Redbird tries his hand at espionage as “V-8, the Super-Spy”, he quickly realizes hes gotten in over his head.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Bibi has a terrible no-good day after she keeps messing up and lets Joker get away. She doesn’t think he can help Batgirl anymore, but a “bad today” doesn’t mean it’ll be a “bad tomorrow".

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: On a trip to Japan to visit Velmas friend, the gang comes face to face with the ancient crab monster, Kaniaku, and attempts to solve a 700 year-old mystery. Meanwhile, Daphne accidentally becomes a viral media sensation in Japan!

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: When the ghost of a small towns founder returns to scare off mayoral candidates, the gang decides to run Velma as mayor to bait the ghost. They quickly discover, however, that Velma lacks the skillset to make her a popular politician!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean accidently causes Mrs Wicket to be hospitalised and in need of a wheelchair. Back home Mr Bean has thoughtfully set up a bell service so that he can be at Mrs Wicket’s beck and call at any time of day or night. Mrs Wicket likes this...a lot. The bell doesn’t stop ringing and an exhausted Mr Bean finds himself running up and down the stairs carrying and fetching until he eventually loses patience with his patient.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Determined to play the piano, Mr Bean finds a tune in his heart and sausages for fingers.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Its the start of a Fun Run. Mr. Bean lines-up beside his deadly enemy: the fat bloke who stole his parking space. Fun Run or no, nothing will stop Bean beating this man to the finishing post, even if he has to flag a cab.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean ends up on stage at the opera house...in a dress!

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: “Chasing Lamput” turns out to be the ultimate backstage pass; the Docs pursue the orange blob through the dressing room and directly onto the stage of a gigantic stadium rock concert. The crowd goes wild. Which raises questions about their taste in music, to be honest; Skinny plays guitar like he’s gotten himself tangled in the strings (which he has), and Specs’ drumming, well, it’s certainly got passion. No taste, skill or rhythm, but certainly passion. The stage ends up in tatters by the time the actual band arrives. Those Docs are a hard act to follow.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: A van pulls up to the rangers cabin to deliver a crate of jars of chocolate spread. While Grizzy and the Lemmings fight over a wrecking bar to open it, someone steals the crate.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: As usual, Grizzy picks the door of the Rangers log cabin to come in and make himself comfortable, but this time its impossible to enter!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings have got their hands on a pack of white beans which have very strange properties: when mixed with soda, anyone who eats them turns into a bouncing ball.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings are having a blast with a bowling game they found in the Rangers storeroom. Grizzy hastens to destroy the pins to ensure his peace and quiet. But the Lemmings discover a remote-control device that can modify the balls weight. By setting it on maximum, the ball could knock over much more than pins: furniture, a bear and even a log cabin!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings inherit a crate that fell off a Canadian army convoy. Inside, a case emits a sort of laser beam that divides objects into multiple miniaturized versions of themselves.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Near the supermarket a machine hands out surprise eggs in exchange for a coin. Amongst the lots to be won, there is a super firework rocket the Lemmings dream of, and a piece of costume jewelry that Grizzy imagines himself giving to his lady-love.

programme.title: SuperThings: Rivals of Kaboom - Kazoom Power
programme.desc: During training at the Hero Base, the SuperThings mistake Kid Fury for a villain because of his yellow eyes.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Scooby runs into an old kennel mate Axel who is a highly trained Police dog who thinks mystery of the Junk yard monster is too big a case for the gang.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: When a successful video game company tries to convince Velma to work for them in San Francisco the gang becomes embroiled in the mystery of a video game villain.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Lamput outsmarts the Docs by luring them onto a street basketball court and pitting them against the toughest ballerz in town. When the jocks look like utterly destroying poor old Specs and Skinny, Lamputs conscience kicks in. Our orange buddy decides to help the Docs out with some of that special brand of court magic. Fate is fickle, though - when it comes out that the Docs are using a performance-enhancing orange blob, the jocks call foul. Specs and Skinny are reminded yet again what it feels like to be dunked on.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean and Teddy have no plans, so decide to stay in bed all day. Mr Bean is determined that his feet can’t touch the ground, so he pushes the bed around with a broom. He has to find ingenious ways to make his tea and toast for breakfast, brush his teeth and an even bigger challenge of ordering a pizza and collecting it from downstairs without getting out of bed!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: After seeing the flashy electric go-kart Mr Paliwal has bought for his daughter Divya, Mr Bean and Billy build their own using items around Mrs Wicket’s garden. At the go-kart track, Mr Bean and Mr Paliwal are unimpressed with Billy and Divya’s driving skills so take the karts for a “proper” race around the park. Meanwhile Mrs Wicket is on the warpath when she finds things missing from her house.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean embarks on plenty of adventures, along with his sidekick, Teddy. They try to stay out of the way of Mrs Wicket and her cat Scrapper, but often end up in trouble.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The hapless hero visits the Science Museum, where he makes a new friend with a bagful of gadgets.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: A magic tomahawk divides Grizzy into two identical bears with diametrically opposite personalities: one short-tempered, the other super-sweet. The Lemmings, who did not witness Grizzys split, will have a hard time working out the behavior of their usual enemy, who seems to swing from excessive kindness to the worst trickery for no reason.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: After studying a magazine advertisement with a couple standing in front of an SUV Grizzy imagines that if only he had a nice car his favorite she-bear would be

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: While chasing the Lemmings Grizzy crashes into an arcade cabinet near the supermarket which displays a model fortuneteller and her crystal ball.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: A newly unpacked UV tanning booth holds the place of honor in the middle of the cabin. Grizzy gets it into his head that a classy tan will help him draw the attention of the she-bear hes enamored with. When he opens the box, he discovers that the Lemmings have beat him to it and are already playing "beach party" inside the bed.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings have turned the entire cabin topsy-turvy to organize medieval jousts with the rangers fencing gear. Grizzy, who wishes to recover his couch, tries to straighten up, but is driven out by their fencing foils. To retaliate, Grizzy must find a blade equal to the task. He opts for a fine... frozen swordfish!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: A strange object is delivered to the Rangers cabin: an over-board! Its a latest generation skateboard which levitates above the ground without wheels.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings discover the joys of photography with the rangers instant print camera.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When a group of alley dogs, aided by a heroic stray, are saved from Catwoman by kind-hearted Buff, he brings them all back to live in the Batcave.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When Jestah injures herself preparing for an extreme sports competition with the other Zoomers, Bibi helps her overcome her fear of going to the mechanic so she can heal up in time to compete.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When Buffs trusty winch is knocked out of action by Poison Ivy, he must learn to improvise and come up with creative solutions on the fly.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When Snowy and Jestah team up to execute a mysterious plan involving rare freeze-berries, Batwing and Buff pair up to take on the dastardly duo, but Batwing decides to carry out the mission herself, putting both her and Buff at risk.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Witch Hazel hires The Looney Builders to make her house look spooky for Halloween.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: After a hot cocoa disaster, Santa Claus hires The Looney Builders to build him a new toyshop in time to save Christmas.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Mayor Foghorn Leghorn hires The Looney Builders to build a giant water slide for Looneyburg’s waterpark.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: It’s Taz’s birthday, so The Looney Builders build him a huge ice cream sundae.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Jerry battles Tom to save a crab from becoming the Duke and Duchesss main course.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: After taking the heat again from Ginger for Jerrys shenanigans, fed up Tom decides to pack his bags and go home to his birth family. But can you ever really go home again?

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry are hired by Dixie Wolf to find all the sheep that have gone missing.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Frankenstein turns Tom into a colossus and Tom ends up terrorizing the village mice until Jerry Van Mouseling saves the day.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: A guilty conscience causes Butch to change his ways. But Tom Jerry Spike and Tuffy quickly decide they like the old Butch better.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Toms assigned laundry duty at the estate and Jerrys determined to soil the job.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Madhu has special presents for Ella and Slippy, to celebrate the anniversary of the day they met.But when Ella and Slippy say they can’t hang out, Madhu is sent off with only Maggie for company.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Slippy has heard a rumour that the abandoned outpost the gang plans to visit is haunted so he brings his ghost detector goggles, just in case! Ella assures him that there are no such things as ghosts, but then odd things begin to happen.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ellas mum is a hall of fame Enceladus 500 race champion, and Ella wants to be just like her.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella and Slippy have been practicing their rock-climbing skills, so that they can tackle the recently formed, huge crater on Saturn’s moon, Enceladus. Ella, however, prefers relying on her space boots to get her to the top of the rock wall

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: One little rock can cause a chain reaction by hitting bigger and bigger pieces. Ella inadvertently sends a rock on a collision course for Saturn’s moon, Prometheus. That’s where Ella’s dad has gone to work on a stalled vehicle.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: When Rattys brother comes to visit, Ratty has to pretend that he lives in Toad Hall as he had claimed in his letters. Ratty persuades Toad to be butler, and his friends reluctantly go along with it.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: When Mole goes to find Hedge in the Wild Woods without his glasses, the weasels play a nasty trick on him, and Mole falls into a ditch with Hedge. How will they ever get out to find Badger and get Moles glasses fixed?

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Toad boasts he can get to the seaside in his hot air balloon and be back in time for his grand dinner. He soon gets into trouble and crash lands in the Wild Woods. Trapped in the ropes and branches of trees, Toad is helpless to stop the weasels marching on Toad Hall.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Toad commissions a portrait of himself from Mrs. Otter but cant keep still enough for her to paint him. Will there ever be a portrait of Toad hanging in Toad Hall?

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: When Toad throws out an old chair, he immediately regrets it but the Weasels have now claimed it. Can Toad and his friends persuade them to return it to him?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: At a concert, Mr Bean would love to get an autograph from his idol Roxy. A difficult mission, but will love win?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is over the moon when he meets Mr. Pod because both men have so much in common; same shirt, jacket, trousers and underpants. And to top it all, Pod is Bean’s spitting image! Bean falls to Earth with a bump, though, when his girlfriend, Irma Gobb, finds Mr. Pod much better looking than him.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean makes his own horror movie and ropes in Mrs Wicket as the star!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean has to look after Mrs Wicket’s goldfish but Scrapper the cat is keen to ‘help’.

programme.title: The Agenda
programme.desc: A weekly talk-show looking beyond the headlines and “accepted wisdom” to find the real story. Hosted by award-winning journalist and presenter Stephen Cole, The Agenda quite simply sets The Agenda . You won’t find the same-old talking heads recycling platitudes; instead thought-provoking guests to debate and explore key issues of today’s world. Using virtual reality graphics to bring subjects to life, Stephen will navigate through subjects ranging from “Prove That Climate Change Exists” to “Who Will Win the Race to Space”. Opposing views will be given opportunity to flourish and develop into a meaningful conversation. The Agenda: No nonsense talk; Challenging perceptions.

But by morning, the unlikeliest of reconciliations leaves the group raising eyebrows. As the women split off for a day of alpaca walking and countryside shopping, calm returns. Later, a classic car ride to a country pub takes an emotional turn when Karen opens up about her childhood, prompting an unexpected moment of group vulnerability. But the peace doesn’t last, and a cryptic Instagram post – shared in the dead of night – sends the women searching for answers.

programme.title: The Real Housewives Of London After Show
programme.desc: The ladies crown the most stylish Housewife, reflect on Panthea and Juliet M’s tender van moment, and try to decode Karen’s cryptic Instagram post.

programme.title: Where Did It Come From?
programme.desc: Explore the historical origins of things we use in everyday life, from modern medicine to weapons of mass destruction, and from sports stadiums to tools of astrology.

programme.title: Unidentified: Inside Americas UFO Investigation
programme.desc: The veterans testify to an extraordinary series of encounters between U.S. Military and UFOs dating to the Vietnam War. Are these the same unidentified craft shown in U.S. Navy videos and have they been shadowing American forces for decades?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: ‘Ancient Aliens’ examines 75 million years of the most credible alien evidence here on Earth, from the age of the dinosaurs to ancient Egypt to the skies over the western desert in present day USA.

programme.title: Search For The Lost Giants
programme.desc: Several years ago, Bill and Jim Viera stumbled upon something in the Massachusetts woods that could alter the course of human history. The brothers found a set of structures that could be the clue to a lost civilisation.

programme.title: Chasing Mummies
programme.desc: Follow legendary archeologist Dr Zahi Hawass as he discovers new archeological finds while managing 250 digs throughout Egypt. He and his team unearth new treasures, ranging from incredibly preserved mummies to, perhaps, Cleopatras tomb.

programme.title: Warriors
programme.desc: ‘Warriors’ delves deep into the warrior mindset: the rites of passage, the initiations and the rituals, which reveal what makes them rise above the rest of humankind to lead, to fight, and in some cases, to die.

programme.title: River Hunters
programme.desc: Beau Ouimette and Rick Edwards battle the forceful River Tees, searching for lost Tudor relics from a gruesome 16th-century siege at Barnard Castle and secrets of the ancient borderland. During their search, the duo unearth some potential medieval finds that could have been used in the castle at the time of the siege and also come across other finds likely to date back to the 1600s and 1700s.

programme.title: The Universe
programme.desc: A crucible of creation and destruction, with Earth on its edge, the Milky Way is just one galaxy among millions. Discover its complex tapestry of science.
