programme.title: Ross Kemp: Shipwreck Treasure Hunter
programme.desc: Ross tries to find out more about his sea-faring Great Grandfather, Arthur ‘Pop’ Chalmers. He discovers that Pop served in the Merchant Navy and survived three shipwrecks. Inspired to know more, he links up with maritime archaeologist, Mallory Haas.

programme.title: Secret History Of Humans
programme.desc: Learn the fascinating story of how 12 surprising forces have shaped human civilisation, helping to form the world of today.

programme.title: Secret History Of Humans
programme.desc: Over millions of years, mankind has evolved from a vulnerable creature to a dominant force on the planet. Occasionally the planet bites back, with terrifying consequences that have shaped our evolution.

programme.title: Brad Meltzers Lost History
programme.desc: Brad Meltzer og seerne er på jagt efter forsvundne eller stjålne historiske ting, bl.a. en plakette til minde om Roots af Alex Haley, samt et originalt eksemplar af Bill of Rights og en mystisk ring, som blev båret af Lee Harvey Oswald.

programme.title: Brad Meltzers Decoded
programme.desc: Best-selling author Brad Meltzer decodes ordinary objects in both the modern world and history – objects that contain secret messages, steeped in codes and symbols.

programme.title: The Curse Of Civil War Gold
programme.desc: The team are excited to find promising evidence on the 19th-century property of a Civil War general - a site where gold is rumoured to be buried.

programme.title: In Search Of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos, an expert on H2’s ‘Ancient Aliens’, is continually asked to visit sites and speak about the topics covered in the series. This show explores the possibility of a spin-off series, with Giorgio himself as the featured talent.

programme.title: Countdown To Apocalypse
programme.desc: As the world waits to see if the ancient Mayan apocalypse prophecy December 21, 2012 is correct, the new H2 series, Countdown To Apocalypse, tells the rest of the story.

programme.title: The Universe: Ancient Mysteries Solved
programme.desc: Astronomical events were once thought of as heralds of ill omen. But what could these events have been? And did any of them shape history?

programme.title: Lost Gold Of World War II
programme.desc: In the closing months of WWII, legend has it that the Japanese buried something of immense value deep in the Philippine jungle. A group of investigators and engineers are using the latest technology to search for the treasure and the truth.

programme.title: Ancient Top 10
programme.desc: Ancient Top 10 is a smart, fun countdown that details how ancient technology worked, how surprisingly advanced it was, and how it was kind of awesome!

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: Investigate the facts and myths surrounding UFO sightings in every corner of the world. Examine evidence and eyewitness accounts and explore the mystery of what happened or what didnt happen.

programme.title: Missing In Alaska
programme.desc: ‘Missing in Alaska’ investigates the region of northwest Alaska, where over 20,000 people have vanished in an area locals call the Alaska Triangle. In all these cases, the bodies are rarely discovered. Who or whats behind these cases is unknown.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: Bob Baer and his team offer an inside look at the investigation into the fate of Adolf Hitler. Along with previews of the next stage, they share their most explosive evidence and explain how they plan to crack the greatest cold case in history.

programme.title: Engineering Disasters
programme.desc: ‘Engineering Disasters’ goes beyond the headlines to uncover what really happened in the most notorious engineering accidents.

programme.desc: As the team moves closer to retrieving what they believe to be the Chappell Vault, a dangerous event occurs in the Money Pit, and the Fellowship must adjust their plans quickly to avoid disaster.

programme.title: The Unxplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Many of us fantasise about trying on a new identity, but when does the line between impersonation and transformation become blurred? Is it possible that by pretending to be someone else, a person can actually change their identity?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A seller Super Bowl Shuffles into the shop with merchandise signed by Da Bears. Chum strikes a jumpman pose as he checks out a bronze Michael Jordan statue. Corey says hello to his little friend--a replica 1963 Cadillac from the movie "Scarface."

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Turtlemania hits the shop when a seller tries to pawn a 1991 Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles action figure and prototype. Will Chum say "cowabunga" to the customers asking price or will it be a hard "shell?"

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ancient Aliens is counting down the top ten disasters ever documented with a possible otherworldly connection, from a flying monster at a nuclear incident, a meteor that wiped out the dinosaurs, and a deadly virus that might be from another world.

programme.title: The Unxplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Many believe it to be the Word of God, while others claim it contains inconsistencies that could only be manmade. But whether actually divine, or merely divinely inspired, the Bible is inarguably the most important historical text ever written.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick swings for the fences on some major league memorabilia from one of baseballs best. Corey and Chum go to the end of the road authenticating a Boyz II Men jacket. Chum is starstruck by some unique items from the golden age of Hollywood.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out the most expensive item in Pawn Stars history, the only 1933 Double Eagle gold coin for sale in the world. Will Rick be able to mint a deal, or will the seller try to nickel and dime him?

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: Did a filmmaker capture footage of a wooly mammoth crossing a river in Siberia? Is a recording of a long moaning howl proof that Bigfoot lives in Ohio? Is Sophia the talking robot really out to destroy humanity?

programme.title: Historys Greatest Escapes With Morgan Freeman
programme.desc: During the Civil War, a daring prison break frees hundreds of captured Union soldiers; Colonel Thomas Rose was a schoolteacher before the Civil War; when he was captured and sent to Libby Prison in Richmond Virginia, he engineers a mass escape.

programme.title: Historys Greatest Escapes With Morgan Freeman
programme.desc: An Iranian-American psychopath is thrown into the mens city jail in Orange County Jail in Southern California. Before he gets sent to a higher security prison, he escapes the five-story prison.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: There are stories of advanced technology from the ancient past that seem too impossible to be true. They are spoken of in legends and myths. Is our most cutting-edge modern technology merely reinventions of those that existed thousands of years ago?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens: Ultimate Evidence
programme.desc: Could some of our ancient texts and structures be home to secret messages left by alien ancestors? If so, what can we learn from them?

programme.title: Historys Greatest Escapes With Morgan Freeman
programme.desc: An Iranian-American psychopath is thrown into the mens city jail in Orange County Jail in Southern California. Before he gets sent to a higher security prison, he escapes the five-story prison.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare befriends a little yellow fluffy creature by the river, and it follows him everywhere, quacking and copying his every move. It’s too little to speak and doesn’t look like any creature Little Nutbrown Hare or his friends have seen before. How will he return it to its parents if he doesn’t know what kind of creature it is?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare sees Blue Bird building a nest, he thinks it looks like fun, so he and Little Field Mouse build one themselves. But its a bit too scratchy and tickly for them to get comfortable in. They give it to their friends to try out, but they also find it not quite right. Will anybody find their nest cozy and useful?

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Osbourne is teaching Timmy how to do magic tricks. What will he pull out of his hat?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids awesome sandcastle gets trampled overnight. A lone set of footprints along the beach leads to a prime suspect who claims not to have seen their sandcastle, yet hes carrying a big shell that once adorned it. As it turns out, no one touched their castle. The culprit was the rising waters of high tide. / /Huckle, Sally and Lowly discover the impossible – a set of ski tracks that run on either side of a tall tree.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is surrounded by his usual mess! Hopping about, he asks himself why fish live underwater, but birds live in trees? When you need to know go to Okido! Messy lands with a somersault onto his bottom and finds Felix and Zoe are painting their house. “Why?” asks Messy. “You have to take care of the place you live in Messy”, explains Zoe. And just at that moment an alarm goes off… It’s a Cloudship emergency!

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is trying to fly, and doesn’t understand why he can’t. So he jumps into the vortex to go to Okido and find out! When Messy bounces off the trampoline in Okido he flaps his little arms to turn the bounce into flying but he lands with a bump onto his bottom! Zoe and Felix laugh at him for trying to fly, and tell him to go with them to hear Mayor Oki’s AMAZING news. Messy loves anything amazing, so they skidoodle on down to Okido Park.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Blueberry and Huckleberry pitch their new play, an adaptation of the Baby Berrykins’ favorite BerryFairyTale, “The Littlest Berrykin,” to Plum and the assembled cast and crew. We see the story they are narrating in action: a comedy about three princesses (played by Strawberry, Lemon and Raspberry) on a quest for a fabled Golden Berry to determine which of them is best suited to rule the kingdom—the King and Queen (Huck and Blueberry) are retiring to the tropics. Accompanied by their Berrykins-in-Waiting, the Princesses set off on the quest. Whichever one returns with the Golden Berry will be declared the new monarch.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry finds a skipping rope outside his house and decides that Finders should be Keepers, so he goes to Dino World to play with it.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry is nervous about giving a speech about dinosaurs to his classmates.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Zari is bird-watching with her binoculars and then she takes notices a strange shaped nest from a new bird she havent learn of, picking her interest. The bird that built the nest approach her, aggresively chirps at her and Zari tries to befriend the bird. In the garden, Leo And Katie are playing ;parachuting with their jet packs to land on a cardboard box marked with an X. They are having fun but Leo then pulls the cardboard away on the last second, causing Leo to land on his bum. As Leo picks himself up, they receive a call from Zari. Zari wants to share the new bird she discover. The Junior Rangers goes up in their treehouse to learn more and its called the Baya Weaver bird. As they were discussing, Zari informs the Junior Rangers on the threat that 2 lizard causing as they suddenly approach the birds. The Junior Rangers meets up with Zari to help her. When they arrived, Zari infrom them that the lizards went away and the baby birds are safe, but their nest has been destroyed. The Baya Weaver mother bird is still upset and chirps angrily at Zari. Leo comes up with an idea and offer the bird with some seeds. This calms the mother bird down. Afterwards, Zari and Katie hurriedly finish the bed of leabes and put the Baya Weaver babies into it, causing the Baya Weaver mother bird to be more friendly. The Junior Rangers then agree in rebuilding the old nest with the material around but they werent manage to build it properly and made it untidy, causing the mother Baya Weaver unwilling to be in the nest. Ranger Rocky appears and the Hunior Ranger explain the situation and ask for help.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Thomas finds out that the Earls Technology Fair will bring new inventions to Sodor, he sets out to prove that steam engines are the best inventions ever.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas and Edward decide to teach Gordon a lesson after he refuses to thank Edward for rescuing him from Gordon Hill, despite previously berating the smaller engine for being old and unreliable.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Gertrud promised Maria to make a perfume for Toramento with whom she has a first date tonight. Unfortunately, Gertruds laboratory has burned down and with it, all the ingredients. Grisus mission (with Stella’s help) is to find the flowers the perfume requires and to help Gertrud to make the perfume again. But finding the flowers is not an easy thing, especially with Thingy around. Moreover, Grisu, peeved by Fume, spits a flame, and burns all the ingredients once more! But Grisu is a resourceful dragon, and he manages to create the perfume Maria expects just in time for her romantic date!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu helps Professor Smeraldo to retrieve a Dragonosarus egg from the icecap. Fume joins the mission too, hoping to do some dragon training. They must prevent the prehistoric egg, caught in an iceblock, from falling off a crevasse, but a hungry albatross pops out and the mission is not so easy since the ice block ends up falling into the crevasse. Luckily, snowdrift softers the impact but our heroes find themselves without any rope to bring the egg back. In the end, the little dragon creates an ice firefighter pole using Smeraldos searching material and manages the rescue the egg with Fumè’s help.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: A fun, spooky tale from little White Owl leaves the friends a little on edge, so when they hear strange noises in the pumpkin patch, they wonder what kind of creepy creature might be lurking there with them. Will Big Nutbrown Hare be able to convince them not to let their imaginations run away with them?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The friends are all playing together in the Autumn meadow. Little Redwood Fox inadvertently spoils all the games of the day, but the others put their heads together and come up with a game that suits her perfectly.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: In order to earn his badge, Brewster has to invent a fun tour to teach a group of children a little about Chuggington. He decides to show them a Day in the Life of a Chugger – but his tour is so dull! To make matters worse, he accidentally loses his passengers. He finds them with Wilson, having a great time on the turntable. Realising that chuggers work hard, but that they have fun too, he takes his passengers on a ‘Laugh and Learn’ tour around the depot.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Right before they go to bed, the Fox-Badger family dreamily gazes at the snowflakes falling from the sky. Berry would like togo out and build a snowman, but its late. Scoutbadger, Woodsy and Rosie promise that they will make one all together the next morning… Alas! When they wake up the next day, they realize that the snow has already melted.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Mr Bentley is doing vocal warm-ups with the Spring City Rockets, and is about to begin rehearsals for his latest masterpiece, “A Pocketful of Pirates”. As Bob, Wendy, Leo, Dizzy and Muck arrive to renovate the hilltop theatre, Mr Bentley encourages them to join in the warm-ups. But Bob proves to be a hopeless thespian. As he confesses: I’m a builder, not a actor!” But Dizzy shows theatrical flair. When Mr Bentley has to run home and retrieve an important prop, he asks Dizzy to assistant direct. She’s so excited by the task that she accidentally tells Leo to use slow-drying cement instead of fast-drying cement as they begin paving a hillside track down to the theatre. Torn between two important tasks - the play and the build - Dizzy also messes up her directorial duties, telling Brandon to get his pirate props from the wrong box.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Team Bob are on site to create a temporary city beach for the summer in Spring City. Bob explains that they will be using sand from a real beach. Mr. Bentley interrupts to inform them that he wants it to be a ‘Blue Ribbon’ beach, an eco award for the cleanest, safest beaches, so they will have to work hard to keep the site tidy. There will be an inspection later in the day and he is determined for them to get the award for Spring City. Lofty takes this very seriously and is worried when Muck spills sand on the site.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids try to find the owner of a camera using the photos for clues. All the pictures are sporting events, so they eventually find out the camera belongs to the sports reporter for the Busytown Bugle./ A list Sally made mysteriously disappears right off the page.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kai is struggling against the wind as he plods across the sandy, snowy dunes of the Gobi Desert. He gets impatient and tries to fly above with his hover boots but the wind was too strong, causing him to crash back on the sand dune. Kai then stumble upon an injured Bactrian Camel, with its leg being hurt. Back in the garden, Leo And Katie are playing Simon Says. Their game is cut short when Kai calls on Leos watch. After explaining the situation, the Junior Rangers agrees to help and travel to meet with Kai. Once they arrive, Leo is surprised how cold the environemnt is. Katie gives him an extra scarf and gloves. The Junior Rangers then meet up with Kai and the camel has a large rock stuck in its toes. Kai has an idea to use his grabber. Katie holds the leg as Leo tries to distract the animal while Kai pulls the rock out. Kai manages to success pull it out and Katie immediately disinfact the camels foot. The Junior Rangers then wants to reunite camel with its caravan, and they follow the camel who has already walk away. It was troubling for the Junior Rangers as the sand dune is hard to manuever. Katie has an idea to use their jetpack which Kai informs her its not a good idea.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kai is operating his drone to film for his film of the underwater environment. He recorded some fish but none are interesting to him. Then he encounters a starfish that piques his interest and think its the great subject for his film. Back in the garden, Katie are sketching Leo on her notepad as Leo poses. He moves as a fly keeps bugging him, making Katie irritated. Leo then receives a call from Kai who explain of the animal he discover. After learning more about it in the treehouse, the Junior Rangers agree to meetup with Kai in the ocean. Once they arrive, Kai instruct Leo And Katie to act around the starfish but theyre acting was bad. Kai films the starfish but it keeps doing nothing so he fall asleep while Leo and Katie are playing with Hero who is playing with a seashell. As Kai wakes up, they get greeted by Ranger Rocky. The Junior Rangers explain the situations causing him to call for Ranger Joey for more information on the animal. After learning useful tips, they found that the starfish had disappeared and later got carried away in a plastic bag stuck in by a sea turtle. Ranger Rocky manages to distract the sea turtle and Leo grab the plastic with his grabber. The starfish falls over and slowly fall over and reunite with other starfish. The day are saved and the Junior Rangers goes home. Back in the garden, Leo sees the sketch that Katie finished.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and Lou are making a snowman in the yard when they get hit by a load of snowballs, but they cant see whos throwing them. Can they find out who the strange snowballers are?

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly insist on seeing an octopus. They manage to get to the home island of the octopus and in the way back home rainbow-fishes help them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The violin of the poor Cricket breaks. Berry and Dolly takes care that neither the Cricket nor the other animals remain without instrument and music.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Dolly helps Christopher, the canary who broke his wing. In gratitude Christopher takes Dolly to the island where the yellow ladybird lives.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry visits his distant relative, Snail Sam.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Pando and me did music all together.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are playing a vooshing game with their favourite toys, Hoppity Voosh and Hippo Fairy. They throw them into the air to see how high they can fly – Voooooosh! Uh-oh…Sula’s hippo gets stuck in a tree so Bing throws Hoppity up to save her, only for Hoppity to get stuck too.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando are playing outside in the cold, blowing steamy dragon breath at each other and discovering icicles hanging from the tap. Flop makes hot chocolate to warm everybody up but Bing can’t wait for it to cool down before he can drink it and burns his fingers – Pando’s quick thinking brings the icicle to the rescue.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Charlie is coming to play and Bing has planned lots of things for them to do. But when Charlie arrives he doesn’t want to play any of the games Bing has put out. Bing is upset until Flop suggests they watch to see what Charlie really wants to do. Charlie heads straight for the kitchen where he, and Bing, have a great time making music with pots and pans.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: One day, Tilda opens her front door and cant believe her eyes: theres an egg in her front garden. While Tilda asks Robin Robin for tips on egg care, Molly distributes flyers in Wild Rose Lane to find the owner. After a while, the egg cracks open and a chick hatches. As at that moment Tilda is not at home, the chick thinks Molly is its mother.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: As Rupert would prefer to read than go out for a walk with Tilda, he pretends to have a cold. At once, Tilda declares herself his nurse and makes tea for him, gives him nose massages and makes him gargle, take cold foot baths and do a special keep fit programme.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Spring has arrived and Tilda fervently wants to paint a white sheep on a green meadow. She grabs her easel and sets off. Her friends may have lots of other suggestions for things she could paint, but she has her heart set on a sheep. Her friend Patrick the sheep turns out to be a difficult model: he just cant keep still.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a snowy Winter’s morning Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are amazed at the intricate patterns they find in the snowflakes, each one different from the others. The friends try to take one to show Big Nutbrown Hare, but they always melt before he sees them. Will they find a way to stop the lovely flakes from melting?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare discovers that he has grown a thick Winter coat, he and Little Field Mouse make a coat from moss to help other creatures in the meadow stay warm. They discover that everyone has their own ways of coping in the colder months, but Big Nutbrown Hare uses the coat as a picnic rug on the snow so they can enjoy a Winter feast.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is fascinated that his friend Little Grey Squirrel is going to stay in his dray all Winter long. He and Little Field Mouse decide to hibernate in the hollow log until Spring, but soon become bored and fidgety. Little Field Mouse gives up and plays in the snow. Will Little Nutbrown Hare manage to stay inside, or will he be tempted out as well?

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and Gaspard are having fun in some fog at Grandma and Grandpas house when they bump into a cow which is really big, so Simon and Gaspard are a little uneasy around it.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Peyo and Picos day in the Galapagos Islands takes a turn when they discover a flightless cormorant with a hooked line entangled in on its foot. In the garden, tries to climb a tree to get to a squirrel but fails. Peyo calls Leo and Katie and the rangers learn about the unique birds characteristics. Leo, Katie, and Hero join Peyo in the Galapagos, using PlatypusOnes hoverboard to navigate the shallow waters and the team patiently waits for the cormorant to resurface. Leo successfully removes the fishing line and the team relocates the birds to a safer habitat with other cormorants. Back in the garden, Hero continues to climb the tree to continue his squirrel chase and falls down to Leo and Katie’s concerns but it is revealed he has his jetpack on.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Jayden, strolling along the riverbank in a wetland forest, discovers a beaver trapped under some rocks in the river. Attempting to rescue the beaver, Jayden gets his prosthetic leg stuck in the mud, and both he and the beaver become stuck. Meanwhile, in the garden, Leo and Katie build a tall tower of blocks, but Heros playful antics cause the tower to collapse. Jayden calls to let them know of his situation with the beaver. Leo and Katie head to the treehouse to learn more about the American Beaver. Armed with information, the Junior Rangers, along with Hero, rush to the wetland forest to rescue Jayden and the beaver. After a challenging rescue involving lifting rocks with jetpacks, they free the beaver. However, the beaver appears distressed, a call to Ranger Joey lets them know that beavers use tail slaps to signal danger. Danger came soon enough when a bear approached. Leo comes up with a clever plan involving PlatypusOne distracting the bear while Leo, Jayden, and Hero keep the beaver company. With Ranger Rockys help, they bandage the beavers tail and find its family. In the treehouse, Leo hangs a photo of the healed beaver, while below, Katie builds the tallest tower yet and Hero’s tail causes it to topple but it remains standing.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn their badges, the trainees must devise a fitness routine. Wilson climbs on the train jack and has Lori move him up and down. But Lori points out that she is the only one getting a work out! When Wilson tries to move off the jack his wheels spin and spin and he discovers it’s the perfect ‘stationary bike’ for a chugger! He demonstrates his wheel work out and wins his badge

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: The trainees must learn to trust each other. One of them will close their eyes while the other guides them around. Koko is very good at leading Brewster around, but finds it hard to close her eyes and trust him to guide her. When she realises that Brewster won’t earn his badge if she doesn’t let him lead, her strong sense of friendship overrides her fear, Brewster guides her around successfully, and they both win their badges.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Dad sends Tchoupi and Nina out on a mission: to go to the vegetable garden and find the veggies he needs to make a nice mixed salad! The kids are delighted… until they discover that the tomatoes - the main ingredient for Dad’s salad - are green instead of red! Nina comes up with a solution she heard about from her mom: music!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When Fanni accidentally knocks over Tchoupi and Nina’s "cushion cabin," it prompts them to build a real cabin, in the forest, opening up a whole new adventure! However, when they get to the forest, Tchoupi grows increasingly scared after spotting a spider! In the end, however, he realizes that the animals of the forest are actually way more nervous than he is!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When T’choupi misses out on going to the market with Fred, Nina decides to cheer him up by suggesting they "sell their wares at the market," like a couple of adults -right there, in the hamlet where they live! The friends find some great produce, which they then promptly sell to their parents. The latter are delighted with their wares; only problem is, Dad would have loved to be able to bake a yummy pie but has no eggs with which to make it…

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Medhi has planned a basketball workshop today. He starts off with a demonstration to show that hes a real champion! But the next minute, hes suddenly very bad! Charley and his friends are lost: whats happened to him? Whats more, Medhi gets the childrens names wrong... And what if Medhi isnt who we thought he was?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia were supposed to attend a cartoon screening at the theater, but Sam has to babysit the triplets. Is there a way to keep an eye on them and still go to watch the movie?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: As a young fisherman, GrandPa was thanked by a king for having saved him from the pirates. The monarch offered him two large rubies that he hid in the residence. Can Sam and Julia find them?

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: When railway inspectors come to the Island of Sodor, they start their inspection on Thomas’ branch line. Thomas, Annie and Clarabel are keen to show what they can do, but there are nothing but problems: a stuck window in a hot carriage, naughty schoolchildren pulling the emergency cable and animals on the line! To make matters worse one of the inspectors is very grumpy. But when Annie discovers that he’s left his gold watch on her seat, Thomas sets out to return it and that finally impresses the grumpy inspector more than anything.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: When Henry hears that the Fat Controller’s grandchildren have chickenpox, he starts to worry about whether engines can get chickenpox too. Then he meets Thomas who has been splattered with mud and is carrying a wagon of chickens, and becomes convinced of it! It seems like every engine Henry meets is splattered with something that looks like spots and it’s not until the end of the day that poor Henry discovers that chickenpox is not really a problem for engines after all!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou Leo and Clementine go to a "high ropes" park with Clems brother. Clementine and Caillou learn to be supportive friends and help Leo conquer his fears.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou struggles in a test at school and gets caught cheating. He learns to admit when things are hard so he can be helped.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When a new nameplate is about to be placed on the statue of Admiral Hornblast, it suddenly disappears. Huckle, Sally and Lowly check out the photos and videos taken at the scene and ultimately determine that the statue slide over the plate when it was bumped by an out of control bulldozer./Pig Will and Pig Won’t are playing spies. However Pig Won’t suddenly finds himself out of the game when his Secret Spy Ring disappears!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey wants to dress up as something special no one has ever seen before... Mole then appears and tells them about how birds of paradise are known as being unique. When they arrive at the forest, they meet Bird of paradise. They learn about finding their unique look and grove, and Monkey invites Bird of paradise to play Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: We see Parrot packing a picnic basket, Mole appears and suggests taking a magnifying glass so they can explore nature and all of its small wonders. When they arrive they spread out the food. Monkey turns to thank Parrot for the sandwich, when he looks back he discovers the food is gone leaving only a trail of crumbs. Monkey follows the crumbs until he gets to Mouse.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Charlie takes Sarah, Mandy and Norman out to sea. But the kids tussle over who should be captain until Charlie is knocked into the sea and Norman causes the engine to catch fire.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: While Lizzie teaches at the Fire Station, Norman and Hannah help keep things running at the Pontypandy Vets… except both sheep manage to escape AND Norman startles Prince the horse, who runs away and gets stuck in sinking mud at the tidal flats!

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: The Super Cluepers try to find a bunch of carrots that have gone mysteriously missing from the Rabbit family garden. But they finally realize that taking your time to think things through one step at a time is more fruitful than going for the easy answer. Franklin pretends to like pickles to spare Beaver’s feelings, but she gets the wrong idea and thinks he loves them. programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Basil, who has promised Rosie to go with her to find a rare leaf, hears Scoutbadger doubting his ability to keep his promises. To reassure Rosie, Basil decides to do even better than his promise, he will bring his daughter the most beautiful of rare leaves. Unfortunatley, he has problems and cannot make the rendezvous. Rosie is disappointed. Scoutbadger realises that he should not have doubted Basil and repairs his mistake…

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky wonders about the island in the distance. He would like to see it more closely, but how? Fortunately, Doodleboo has the solution.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Doodleboo is invited to the inauguration of a new play park, but Sketcky cannot accompany him. Fortunately, Doodleboo found him the best babysitter!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Its a deal-Doodleboo, Sketcky and Bubble go on vacation. But seeing Sketcky rack up the baggage, Doodleboo digs his head to find a way to transport everything without getting tired. What will his good idea be this time?

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave befriend a little lost bug called Buddy, and take him back to his jungle home. They know that Buddy Bug will be safe and snug when they find his home, so they search for bugs that look just like Buddy and make sure he is reunited with his family.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave put on a magic show for their friends. They choose cool magician names and Hatty teaches them the ‘trick’ behind three special magic tricks. Dave, the Marvellous Mysterioso makes a banana magically disappear, The Terrific Tweeto moves a pencil without touching it and Ruff-Ruff, the Great Barko Bongo amazes everyone by making some froggy-friends magically appear from Hatty’s hat!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare discovers he cant fit under his favourite hiding log anymore. Big Nutbrown Hare learns that you are never too young to play.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Big Nutbrown Hare tells Little Nutbrown Hare a beautiful full moon will rise that night, Little Nutbrown wants to invite all his friends around for a celebration. programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You

programme.desc: Bing has a great time choosing the perfect present for Sula in Padgets shop. Its a wand and is sparkly and flashy and spinny and Bing knows that she will love it. Bing is thrilled until it is time to hand the present over.

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Berry And Dolly

programme.desc: Berry becomes sad because he can not climb on the rainbow but Dolly makes him happy with an exceptionally creative present.

programme.desc: Mr. Rabbit makes up coupons for free cookies to celebrate the grand opening of his cookie shop and gives them to his young son to drop in the mailbox outside. But Mim-Mim has never flown a flower before, and Kate must help him gain his confidence to become a fully-fledged flower pilot.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: After having to stay indoors during a summer shower, Tchoupi and Nina are happy to be able to go back outside and play. Naturally, with rain comes snails. But unfortunately, T’choupi accidentally drops one, denting its shell. There’s no way he’s going to just walk away and leave it to its fate! So Dad advises the kids on how to take care of the gastropod… not an easy feat, when all it wants to do is run away...!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are playing in the cottage when a big "boom" startles them. Running out onto the terrace, they find a stunned sparrow: it’s obvious the small bird flew into the window and has gotten a big bump from the collision! Dad insists the animal needs peace and quiet in order to recover. T’choupi and Nina set themselves the mission of tending to the wounded bird. But disruptions in the cottage, such as a fleeing goat and a chasing cat, make their task way more difficult than expected! Will T’choupi and Nina manage to help the sparrow fly again?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia have decided to play doctors to help their friends stuffed animals and heal dolls hurts. Dr. Julia and Sam, her nurse, pay visits to some of them in the Mouse Mansion.

programme.title: Sam And Julia

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: In Tildas garden, Robin and another robin are quarrelling over an earthworm. Tilda wants to save the poor worm and distracts the birds by suggesting a competition. First, the robins should compete at cherry stone-spitting. This ends in a draw and Tilda sets the next task: pecking out a pattern in a leaf. Both birds peck out a star, so its a another tie.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Eliott has read about a lot of world records: the world’s oldest person, the highest jump or even the longest beard! How incredible! The Triplets decide to break their very own record. However, it is easier said than done and it seems that pretty much all records have already been broken, which means that they are going to have to be extremely creative. Who knows, maybe they will break the silliness record?

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Turbulent is quite upset! In a fit of jealousy, he accuses Mom of always serving more food to Poet than him. Mom decides to tell them the story of Boum and Baboum, two bear-cubs who were very jealous of each other and who decided to pay a visit to their Grandfather. One of them had a cake in his bag and, the other, a bottle of lemonade. During the walk, they got thirsty and hungry but found it impossible to come to an agreement and share their supplies. In the end, a fox ends up eating most of the cake... Leaving them barely anything. A good way to be cured of ones tendency to jealousy.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: All of the forest dwellers are on high alert because of animminent threat of flooding. Edmund and Margaret give each of the children a small basket so they can take the essentials with them. For Scoutbadger, Rosie and Berry, the choice is quite simple, but for Woodsy, very attached to all his objects, its a real ordeal... How will he make up his mind when time is running out?

programme.desc: Zephie and Piper attempt to prove they are ready for the big jobs in Chuggington.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Brewster tries to get busy Action Chugger to play a game of hide-and-seek.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Fred has found some bowling pins he had as a child. He asks T’choupi and Nina if they want to play but they turn him down, finding the game too old. But when Dad arrives on the scene, his face lights up as soon as he sets eyes on the pins: he had this same game when he was little, and used to love playing it! Seeing their nostalgic dads playing, T’choupi and Nina realize that they too would like to join in. But their fathers are having so much fun that they don’t dare disturb them… Maybe they could make their own bowling pin game, instead…?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In this adventure, Kyle discovers a vibrant Peacock Spider in the Southern Australian Forest, fascinated by its cute and colorful appearance. Curiosity piqued, he calls the Junior Rangers, interrupting their game of musical statues. Concerned about the spiders potential venom, they consult their computer for information, learning about the spiders unique features and the dance it uses for courtship. Suddenly, a female brown spider interrupts the males dance and gets aggressive to which Leo, Katie and Hero fly off to Kyle to assist him. As they arrive, the brown spider continues to chase the colorful spider which leads to chaos as the spider jumps around, onto everyone, especially Kyle. The spider eventually seeks refuge on Kyle’s hat. They stumble upon Ranger Rocky, who calls Ranger Joey to give them insights on the spiders mating dance. With newfound understanding, they assist the male spider with its dance by dancing with it together and dressing up Kyle in colorful leaves to get its attention. With everyone dancing, including Hero, the male spider finally dances again and successfully impresses the female as they crawl away together. Back at the Treehouse, Leo, Katie, and Hero continue their game of musical chairs.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: It turns out whether there are witches or not, and that it is not nice to frighten others.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly

programme.title: Berry And Dolly

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly accidentally ruin the snowman of Balthazar but finally they build an even nicer one jointly.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing gets very enthusiastic when he and Sula paint a mural and his painting starts to drop all over Sulas. Sula is upset until she realises that the painting isnt spoiled, its just different.

programme.desc: Bing gets stuck when he takes a game of hide-and-seek too far.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: The continuing problem with the town’s power keeps the Berrykin crews digging and the girls from doing their work—especially frustrating Cherry, who is struggling to write a song. Strawberry rallies their spirits by suggesting a fun way for them to spend the day out of town: a treasure hunt! The girls divide into two teams, each leaving clues for the other that lead to funny objects. The team that collects all the objects first, wins the grand prize—a bag of banana chips from Strawberry’s Cafe that look like gold coins. While the girls have fun, Berrykins Ed and Earl struggle to uncross the crossed juice cables under the cafe floor. Woodsy notices that Loudo is not his usual perky self and Loudo tells him his secret, but has him promise not to tell anyone. Woodsy ends up stuck between his promise and his desire to help Loudo get rid of the cats - which cannot be done without adult help.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You

Big Nutbrown Hare encourages his son to think about everything he knows about his friend. He remembers she likes to look nice on her birthday, so her makes her a lovely necklace and she is delighted!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare keeps winning a game with Little Field Mouse, and enjoys it so much he doesnt realise she is frustrated with losing. programme.desc: Bing falls in love with a lost dog he and Flop find in the park and decides he wants to keep her. When the owner turns up Bing is very upset when it comes to saying goodbye to his new friend.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When the children make Eggy heads with eggs and cress seeds, Bing gets impatient and wants his cress to grow quicker so he decides to give Eggy lots of water with the garden hose.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The bunny gets jealous when Sula gives Pando more attention on a playdate. He tries to gain some for himself and ends up being pushed, so Amma show them how to get rid of the anger

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald inadvertently makes a date to watch TV with Henry at the same time that hes supposed to go swimming with Daisy. He tries to do both without telling his friends. But as he runs back and forth, he gets more and more mixed up, with hilarious results. Finally, he confesses the truth, and they decide to combine both activities so that they can all be together.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald goes out to get some cocoa and a newspaper for Henry, who has a bad case of the Arctic Sniffles. On the way, Oswald encounters his friends, who all prescribe different cures – soup, warm clothes, and cough drops. Oswald winds up laden down with the various remedies, and gets caught in a rainstorm as he staggers back home. By then Henry is feeling better, and Oswald is the one with the sniffles!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Leo is late as he’s overslept thanks to staying up late playing a fishing game on his phone. Bob, Lofty, Leo and Wendy are installing a satellite dish and at the Spring City News HQ located at the docks. The dish has to be in place in time for the Six O’Clock News bulletin. En route to site the team stop to say hello to the Spring City Rockets who are practicing in preparation for a dance show later that day which will be covered on the news. On site Leo and Lofty are teamed up. During the build Leo is distracted by the game; Lofty suggests he should pay more attention. While tying the dish to Lofty’s hook Leo - distracted by the game - does not secure it properly. As Lofty raises the dish it comes loose and drops to the floor.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: After a solar panel demonstration, Mayor Madison decrees that the Sea Life Center will be entirely powered by renewable energy. Bob and the team must build a wind farm, which excites Scoop - he cant wait to see the spinny things going round. As they begin construction, Mr Bentley arrives and pulls Bob away, enthusing about other renewable energy schemes they have planned. Spring City will need more energy as it grows, so they need to think ahead. Scoop decides he should think ahead like Mr Bentley suggests, and convinces Lofty to move some of the turbines closer together.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Big Nutbrown Hare teaches Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends to play hide-and-seek, but the boisterous little hare finds it hard to stay still and quiet, especially when the Spring meadow is full of birds, butterflies and lizards to chase. When he does manage to stay still and quiet he finds the creatures of the meadow come to him… even very shy ones.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare finds a very special feather with bright colours, spots and soft tickly bits. Just as he shows off to his friends how it can fly and float, a cheeky bird flies away with it. Little Grey Squirrel climbs her tree and discovers the bird using it to feather her nest. Will Little Nutbrown Hare find a way to get his feather back, or will he decide that the bird needs it more than he does?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Spring morning a cute spotty ladybird lands on Little Nutbrown Hare and seems to want to stay with him. All his friends admire the interesting little creature and he feels very special indeed. When she eventually flies away Little Nutbrown Hare follows her, wanting her back. But he understands why she left when he discovers she has lots of tiny spotty babies.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Timmy and Yabba are doing a puppet show for the class. But there is a surprise puppet in the show. Who is it?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The new yellow t-shirt that Sally planned on wearing for her portrait painting has mysteriously turned green. Huckle and Lowly help Sally look for clues as to how this colour-change happened. They discover that mixing different colours results in the creation of a new one. It turns out that the dye from a blue blanket turned the yellow shirt green in the washing machine. / The kids discover pieces of a large metal hand, Huckle and gang are determined to find out to whom they belong.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is throwing some awesome moves on the kitchen counter, dancing with his drink bottle in one hand. When he bounds into the garden and opens the drink, it fizzes out over the top and nearly all of it goes on the floor! He wonders why that happened, so he goes to Okido to find out! When he lands, Zoe and Felix are staring up at the sky because hundreds of birds are all flying in the same direction.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: Messy is making a new jigsaw puzzle in his bedroom and it’s of a dinosaur. “I’d love to see a REAL dinosaur,” he says. He wonders why he’s never seen one… So off he goes to Okido! Messy lands in Zoe and Felix’s garden and cartwheels down the path to catch up with them. Zoe and Felix are carrying sandcastle equipment – Messy picks up Felix’s bucket and puts it on his head. “What’s this?” he asks, “A new hat?” Felix and Zoe laugh and invite him to come to the beach with them. Messy speeds off in excitement!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: A blockage somewhere in the sparkleberry juice system that powers Berry Bitty City results in a repair crew of Berrykins invading the town with jackhammers. The girls leave for the day to avoid the noise and not get in the workers’ way. Trying to make the best of the situation, Strawberry gets an idea for the girls to have fun by holding their own berry bitty relay race—passing the baton from a sailboat race on the lake, to a steeple chase on frogs, to a sky race on birds.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry takes his blue and red robots into Dino World so that he can continue the battle they were having at home, but without Nanas scorn.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: After watching a movie about the life of a Cleopatra, the gang go to Dino World to make Patsy Queen.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Over at the garden, the Junior Rangers are working together on PlatypusOne with new upgrades . Katie uses her tablet to run a diagnostic while Leo checks on the vehicle’s engine. Leos watch suddenly beeps, revealing a call from Kyle, who then sends them a selfie he took with which he describes as the coolest-looking fish hes ever seen. Leo And Katie learned those fishes are actually sharks. They try calling Kyle again but he doesnt answer so they immediately travel to his location. Once theyre there, they can’t find Kyle so Katie uses her tablet to track his GPS location. The Junior Rangers dives underwater as PlatypusOne transforms into a submarine and they search for Kyle. Soon enough, they come across Kyle near 3 hammerheads and he waves Leo and Katie. Kyle explains with a flashback and then Hero goes out of the vehicle to swim with the sharks. Leo tells them the waters are too deep for young sharks to swim at and they need to guide them to shallower water above. Suddenly Ranger Rocky appeared as he was nearby. The Junior Rangers explain their issue so Ranger Rocky calls on Ranger Joey for help. Ranger Joey gives out helpful advice, which gives Katie an idea to use the electrical current of PlatypusOne to guide the hammerhead sharks.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Annie and Clarabel are always complaining to Thomas about going too fast. Thomas likes to tease them, by going too fast or too slow (so Annie and Clarabel will ask him to go faster again). But when Annie and Clarabel find themselves coupled to Caitlin by mistake, they get a taste of what going fast is really like, and poor Thomas gets frightened that they might be taken to the mainland forever.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: A delivery of pipes is being unloaded at Brendam Docks. But the engines start to hear scary spooky noises and soon Salty has them all convinced that it’s the sound of the Flatbeds of Fear. Only Emily insists that there must be a sensible explanation, until she hears the sound herself and gets frightened. But it turns out Emily was right about their being a sensible explanation. The sound was just air blowing over the pipes!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: During an expedition to the jungle, Smeraldo finds an ancient vase from the dragons’ age. Since he needs help to carry the relic to his lab, Grisu will join him in the mission. The job isn’t easy, as the vase is very frail and a bunch of wild animals - especially some cheeky toucans - will get in their way. But with the help of Smeraldo, Olivia and Stella (who sneaked onboard to take part in the adventure), Grisu manages to carry the precious object to a safe place.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: A shooting star has been seen above Dragontown. At it fell in the surrondings, Pr. Smeraldo wants to find it before the wind and the rain bury the stone. Unfortunately, he has a wide area to comb. Its a perfect mission for Grisu and Stella. Equiped with a metal detector, Grisu has to deal with many obstacles, among them Thingy who turns mad every time he hears the detector beeping. And you cant imagine how many metal things lie around. Not only cant Grisu and Stella find the precious meteorite, but also they collect metal waste such as an old whistle, a magnet, wire or a weathervane.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It’s a fine Autumn day and it seems that all of the meadow creatures are out enjoying the sun. Little Nutbrown Hare is surprised that Big Nutbrown Hare knows every single creature in the meadow. He sets out to trick him into believing there is a brand new animal… called a ‘Grrr-umph’, which he cleverly creates out of shadows! Will Big Nutbrown Hare be tricked?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare discovers that everyone else can whistle but him… the birds, Little Grey Squirrel, Otter and even the wind in the river reeds. Inspired by the wind, he practices really hard and eventually learns to blow through a reed himself to make it whistle. He and his friends make a beautiful and eerie whistling symphony amongst the reeds.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Hoot and Toot have to sort some recycling bins in order to earn their Green Machine badges. Toot is anxious to go to the ride-in to see an Action Chugger movie, so she skimps on the job, skipping one of the bins to save time. The twins ask Vee for their badge - and when she tells them they haven’t earned it, they wonder how she knows. When they finish the job properly, they find their badge at the bottom of the bin they skipped!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Its Parents Day! Scoutbadger, Rosie and Woodsy decide to organize a surprise picnic for Margaret and Edmund. But as they start carrying it out, their rather simple idea quickly turns into quite a headache. Each of our three little heroes wants to have it his (or her) way, whether it is to set the menu or pick the right spot. Soon, the whole picnic is in jeopardy!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob, Leo, Muck and Scoop are at Fixham Castle to clear a courtyard wall and restore a bricked-up archway to its original splendour. Leo is taken by a statue of Sir Roger de Fixham riding a horse in the courtyard and Muck and Scoop play charging knights. After the wall is cleared they hear a strange beeping noise. It turns out to be Mr. Bentley who is searching for buried treasure with his metal detector. Bentley tells them The Legend of the Silver Shield – a shield that the knight on the statue originally held but which was later buried somewhere in the castle grounds. Scoop is transfixed! While Bob and the others knock out the bricks from the Archway, Scoop decides to dig around for buried treasure.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob tells a tired Scoop to stay behind at Bobs Yard as he goes to build an ice-cream kiosk at the beach. Scoop keeps finding spurious reasons to radio Bob and make him return to the yard. Finally there’s a real crisis but Bob doesnt believe its anything serious. Scoop takes a burning bin to the beach where it falls on the kiosk roof. Scoop saves the kiosk by scooping sand onto the roof.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Forgetful Mayor Fox has misplaced the giant key to the city that hes supposed to be presenting to a visiting astronaut. Huckle and his pals try to figure out where he set it down. They learn that Mayor Fox did one thing while touring a candy factory that required both his hands - stirring a huge pot of candy goo. Not far away they find a big chocolate-covered key./When Busytown residents are baffled by mysterious door knocking, Huckle and gang discover who it is.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: As Kyle was kayaking near the shoreline to test his speed, he stumble upon a plastic bottle drifting in the water. He picks it up and notice a strange animal inside of it. Back in the garden, Leo And Katie are playing a guessing game. Leo sees a ladybug and have Katie guess it, which she has a hard time answering. Hero, their dog, appears and chase away the ladybug from the flower, causing Leo to lose their game because he cant show it to Katie. Leo then receives a call from Kyle who show him of the fascinating animal. After learning more information on Katies computer, the Junior Rangers agree to meetup with Kyle there to help return the animal to its habitat. Once arriving there, Kyle shows the Blue Sea Dragon to the Junior Rangers. Katie and Leo try looking for a suitable to relocate the animal with Katies tablet, unknowingly seeing that Kyle is attempting to open the bottle to free the animal. Kyle struggle hard and opens it, causing the bottle to go overboard. Leo And Katie looks back and realize the bottle isnt there. Suddenly, Ranger Rocky appear with the bottle, advising them not to litter. Kyle explains himself that he wasnt littering, but was freeing the animal. They see that the animal isnt inside the bottle anymore. The Junior Rangers lost the animal, which Ranger Rocky thinks its a good time to call for Ranger Joey with some valuable information.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: As Zari scoops up water into her bucket to fill onto her sandcastles moat, she accidentally picks up a lost clown fish in the process. Back in the garden, Leo and Katie are playing a try not to laugh challenge, where the opposing side try to make the other person laugh with bad jokes. Katie laughs at a scene of Hero being goofy, which Leo counts as him winning. Leo then receives a call from Zari, informing him of the animal she discovers. After Katie and Leo learn more about the animal on Katies computer, they agree to meet up with Zari to return it to its habitat. Once in the ocean, they try swimming with it and let it go free, but this attracts the attention of a stingray. Leo saves the clownfish and put it back inside the bucket. They then meet up with Ranger Rocky, where they share their issue with the situation. Ranger Rocky calls up Ranger Joey, the ranger with the helpful information. After Ranger Joey debrief them of helpful info, Ranger Rocky excuse himself away as he has to deal with a school of dolphin. The Junior Rangers then finally found the sea anemone and returns the clownfish to its home. The day is safe and they return home. Back in the garden, Katie manages to make Leo laughs with a joke she comes up with.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon has invited his friend Lou to his house so they can play with his new remote control car. But it’s best if they wait until Gaspard takes his nap because Simon is afraid that his little brother is also going to want to play, and that he’ll break the car! The problem is that Gaspard isn’t sleepy and has no intention of napping.. It’s up to Simon and Lou to make him tired. But they do such a good job of it that they too finally fall asleep!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly gets a present but they start a fight to posess it. Finally turns out that they got a tandem bicycle.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a hot summer day, Berry, Dolly, Bubble and Balthazar put on their swimsuits, looked for their buckets, shovels and started to build the loveliest sand castle on the Sand Island.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a sunny autumn day, Berry and Dolly went into to forest to pick blueberries. Flutter, the butterfly girl, and Eddy, the potato beetle joined them as well. When Eddy saw the fruitful bushes can’t help but pick all the best fruits before the others. What’s left to do?

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: It’s December, and it’s gingerbread time! Berry and Dolly love making them. Berry’s house filled with the wonderful smell of the biscuits what the magpie immediately noticed from above. Grabbed the bowl and flew away with it. Oh my!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop see Pando skateboarding and Bing wants a go but its a lot harder than it looks and Bing falls off. Pando finds a clever way to help Bing get his confidence back.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: At Ammas crèche a butterfly lands on Sulas painting. Bing tries to help it go outside but accidentally squishes it. Flop and Amma help the sad children say goodbye.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The playful rabbit wants to draw a big picture, so Flop finds him some chalk to create a stripy, spotty, zig-zag dinosaur on the pavement

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula find a potato in Amma’s vegetable patch with a comical ‘face’, so they take it under their wing, naming it “Nosey”. The two children look after Nosey and show him around the crèche but unfortunately Nosey goes down the slide too quickly and his ‘nose’ falls off. Amma shows them how to plant both bits of potato so that they can grow new potatoes.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: When Molly visits Tilda, her friend is looking for a birthday present for Rupert. In the end, Tilda decides on a blue scarf. Molly suggests sending Rupert the present as a parcel to make the surprise all the bigger. A great idea, thinks Tilda.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Ruperts sensitive hedgehog nose tells him that the weather tomorrow is going to be fantastic. He at once informs Tilda and the two friends decide to prepare a picnic. The other friends join in and the preparations last long into the night, with Molly and Rupert finally falling asleep in Tildas living room. .

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: In Tildas garden, Robin and another robin are quarrelling over an earthworm. Tilda wants to save the poor worm and distracts the birds by suggesting a competition. First, the robins should compete at cherry stone-spitting. This ends in a draw and Tilda sets the next task: pecking out a pattern in a leaf. Both birds peck out a star, so its a another tie.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: After a long quiet winter in the meadow Little Nutbrown hare announces that he can’t wait for winter to be over so he can enjoy the other seasons with their special treats to see, hear and taste. Will the sound of icicles tinkling in the wind, the taste of a frozen Winter berry and some very unusual tracks in the snow convince the little hare that Winter is just as special as the other seasons?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare follows some unusual tracks in the snow that eventually lead him to a shy little spotty deer. He plays with his new friend every day, until she has to leave again with her mother to search for food. Little Nutbrown Hare is sad to see her go, but he’s also glad that he has friends that stay in the meadow all year round.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The snow in the meadow is so deep that Little Nutbrown Hare has to stay under the Old Oak tree. Wondering what he is going to do all day in deep snow and with no one to play with, his imagination soon takes over as he creates new kinds of fun. By the time his friends reach him, Little Nutbrown Hare can’t believe how the time has flown!

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: At the beach, Gaspard does one goof-up after another. He wants to play with Simon but each time he turns out to be a real pain in the neck. He tangles up the string to the kite, makes his brother fall in the water after pushing him on the inflatable ducky-life-preserver...and finally, the cherry on the cake: Simon has built awesome sand castles with Maelle and Gaspard shows up, smashing the tower on one of them and totally destroying the other castle. “I can’t believe it, you did that on purpose!”

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In the Amazon Rainforest, Peyo discovers Black Caiman hatchlings trapped in a mound. In the garden, Leo and Katie are having a race while balancing a ping-pong ball on a spoon, Leo going really fast while Katie is slow and steadying. They get a call from Peyo who alerts them of the eggs which prompts a research on the computer. The rangers learn about the apex predators and their nesting habits, advising Peyo to leave the area but Peyo is already on a rock and worries about bumping into the mother. They fly to aid Peyo and wait for the mother but Hero spots the mother black caiman with a bucket on her head, Leo and Hero rescue her, ensuring her safe return to the nest. Later, as the mother tends to her hatchlings and Leo saves one hatchling almost falling off a rock edge. Back at the garden, Katie and Hero continue the spoon race.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: While on a forest hike, Jayden discovers a wounded red fox kit. Leo, Katie, and Hero engage in an animal sound-guessing game in the garden. Jayden calls them, alerting them of the injured fox. In the treehouse, the computer provides information on red foxes, emphasizing their distinctive sounds. They reach the forest, where Jayden gains the kits trust, and they bandage its wounded paw. Attempting to reunite the kit with its mother, they encounter challenges in producing the correct fox sounds. Ranger Rocky calls Ranger Joey who educates them on the variety of fox vocalizations. The team now knows which sound to play on Katie’s tablet while locating an animal nearby but it turns out to be a coyote. They fend off the coyote with growling fox noises. The kit runs towards another barking sound and it turns out it’s its mother! Mission accomplished. Back in the garden, Hero is looking for Katie who is imitating a fox sound but with Leo’s help, Hero successfully pounces on Katie.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: The trainees are trying for their Starmap badges as they learn to navigate by the stars. Wilson and Koko quickly learn to identify the constellations – but Brewster just can’t see them. Eventually, by concentrating hard and using his imagination, he finally manages to see the ‘pictures’ in the constellations. He follows his Starmap and meets up with Koko and Wilson in Old Town where Olwin is waiting for them.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn their badges, Wilson and Brewster must rescue Emery, who will pretend to be broken down in a tunnel. They spend so much time bickering that a fed up Emery drives off. It looks like Wilson and Brewster won’t earn their badges – until there’s a power cut causing a real emergency. They work together and rescue a now genuinely stranded Emery!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: While out on a picnic with T’choupi and his family, plus Nina, Dad chances upon a four-leaf clover! He gifts it to Fanni as a lucky charm. As a result, convinced that he’s having a bad day, T’choupi is now determined to find a four-leaf clover of his own, to turn the tide and enjoy nothing but good fortune for the rest of the day!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: The parents are hoping Fanni will take her afternoon nap, but she’s still wide awake, playing with her animal sounds toy… Until it stops working… Oh dear! T’choupi quickly steps in and improvises animal sounds. But when he quickly loses interest, Mom comes up with an idea: they should go and find the nearby animals and listen to their cries, straight from the "horse’s" mouth! With a bit of luck, this pleasant expedition will tire Fanni out enough to send her to sleep…

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Picorette the hen has taken over the kids’ swing, using it as a perch. So T’choupi and Nina decide to build her a swing of her own. But getting Picorette to agree to change perches is another matter… Luckily, they’re able to coax her, with food!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: The children cant believe it: its their activity leader Medhi whos teaching them today! Medhi wants to be a schoolmaster when he grows up and wants to find out if he can do it. But Medhi has mistaken them for being much bigger than they are, and has seen it as too difficult for the schoolchildren. Charley and his friends are lost when it comes to multiplication and dictation!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam is passionately reading a book. But Julia accidentally damages the last few pages of it. How Julia could she reinvent for her friend the end of the interrupted story to calm Sams frustration?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia is impressed by Sarah, Sams older sister, who is preparing to sing on the theater stage. Julia does everything to attend the rehearsals but its not always easy to get noticed by a big girl.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Miss Gossip wants to write an article about Julia, as a recent inhabitant. The journalist needs informations about her island, from a book that belong to Julias mother, so not to be loosed...

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Oliver’s brake van, Toad, is in a cheery mood so he starts singing, which Oliver thinks sounds awful. And when Toad spots a stranded whale on the beach, Oliver doesn’t believe him. Luckily Thomas does. He thinks the whale needs help. So they tell the Fat Controller who alerts the Search and Rescue Centre. Flynn and Belle keep the whale wet and Butch tries to drag it back to the water, but the tide is too far out and it’s decided to transport the whale by rail to Brendam Docks to release it back into the water there. Oliver carries the whale on a flatbed and Toad sings to it to keep it calm.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Percy is late to collect some sheep for an agricultural fair and bumps the wagon in his rush to be coupled up, backing into other trucks behind him. Percy is in such a hurry to collect the sheep that he doesn’t realise that there is a hole now at the back of the wagon. One by one the sheep escape without Percy realising. Thomas passes Percy and discovers the sheep and is forced to top and collect them. But the only place for the sheep to ride is in Annie or Clarabel!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and his friends learn about Vikings at school, and then have a Viking imagination adventure at break time.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou wakes up with an itchy rash. Hes supposed to go and see grandma today, but doesnt want to make her sick, so needs to figure out where it came from.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Huckle and the gang hear strange mumbling voices in the Busytown Museum, it begins to look like it’s coming from the new Mummy Exhibit. However, after tracking down the clues and putting them together, the sounds turn out to be the voices of the workmen echoing up through air vents from the basement.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Parrot is drinking his afternoon tea when he discovers Monkey building a bizarre looking extension to the tree house that soon enough falls apart... Mole appears and explains how the beaver is such an amazing builder... they decide to venture to the lake to learn from the beaver. Watching beaver work inspires a fun game of Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey is sitting and looking up at the full moon when he hears a howl makes him jump into Parrots hammock! Mole explains that the howl is a way for the wolf to communicate with other members of its pack.Just then we hear a different howl which sounds very near. It is coming from a wolf cub. Monkey decides to bring the cub back to its pack in the tundra.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: While taking her class on a tour of the airport, Mrs Chen accidentally lifts off in FireSwift and it’s up to Norman to use his gaming skills to control the aircraft until the Rescue Team arrives!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: The Pontypandy Pioneers bake up a storm to earn their baking badge, but when a greasy oven bursts into flames, its time to call the rescue team!

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: While doing their “Who’s Who in Woodland” project - a school assignment where the kids have to find out more about the people in their community - Franklin and Bear assume they already know all there is to know about Mr. Groundhog. But in doing so they almost miss out on a bunch of cool stuff, like the fact he’s actually Woodland’s own expert weatherman! / When Franklin and Fox decide they want to be inventors just like Mr. Fox, they find that tinkering and experimenting are just as important to the process as following a plan. With open minds, they even invent some pretty cool gadgets along the way!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: All of the forest dwellers are on high alert because of animminent threat of flooding. Edmund and Margaret give each of the children a small basket so they can take the essentials with them. For Scoutbadger, Rosie and Berry, the choice is quite simple, but for Woodsy, very attached to all his objects, its a real ordeal... How will he make up his mind when time is running out?

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky is surprised: there are plenty of insects in Doodleboos garden, but almost no flies! Doodleboo knows what flies dislike and makes them fly away, and he will make Sketcky guess!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky is looking for his little dinosaur everywhere and Doodleboo offers him to do an archaeological excavation in the toy box!
